15534.content:
Story 11: Kingdom Hearts: Three Soras

While Naminé is trying to restore Sora's memories while Roxas is in the digital Twilight Town, and without DiZ or Riku currently being there, a Dark Corridor suddenly appears. To her surprise, the person she sees come out appears to be Vexen, previously killed in Castle Oblivion. He reveals that he is actually a replica, one of 44 the real Vexen prepared in secret at Castle Oblivion, just in case something went wrong, so that he could continue his research.

Over time, the replicas started transferring themselves into other Vexen replicas in order to have more replicas to experiment on in order to try to improve them, with the Vexens who shared a body merging. Over time, the Vexens started realizing that they actually were feeling emotions, and not just pretending to well enough to fool themselves, causing some to devote time to research this. The Vexens came to the conclusion that Xemnas lied to control them for some reason, so they decided to prepare the replicas to help the good guys.

By the time he got to Naminé, that Vexen was the only one left, and he had managed to create three perfect replicas, to be used to help Roxas, Naminé, and Xion. Hearing this surprised Naminé, as no one should be able to remember Xion, but Vexen reveals that since he himself never met her, and only knew of her through memories of the original Vexen, along with the knowledge of working on creating her not being lost, that he retained his memories about her.

The two work together in secret, with Naminé working on having two replicas set so that once Sora is combined with Roxas, Roxas and Xion are transferred into the replicas while Vexen prepares hers for after she returns to Kairi. Roxas awakens in rage after Sora gets to Yen Sid's tower and hears the sorcerer dismissing Nobodies and their emotions as fake, as he knows his own aren't fake. Roxas is transferred to the tower upon this, and has a confrontation with Yen Sid and Sora, where everything is laid out, and Sora is horrified about what happened, and the sacrifices made for him, especially after noticing Roxas tearing up.

Xion is restored, joining with Sora and Roxas, while Donald and Goofy have to part ways with them for the moment due to orders, while Naminé goes to meet and combine with Kairi, who Vexen takes to the prepared for Naminé replica, as the two begin adventuring using Keyblades as well.

For the moment, the other choices shall remain blank until I get around to thinking of an adding more stories.

Story 12: Mega Ditto

After the Lake of Rage events, Giovanni finds out about Ash, and looking into it, finds that Ash has been heavily involved in stopping several operations, including finding out the details about Mewtwo hidden in his database. He decides to do something about this hitch in his plans, and has his scientists try to cook up something. One scientist comes across the phenomenon from Kalos called Mega Evolution, and decides to look into that. He brings this up to Giovanni, and decides to use a Ditto for his experiments, due to Ditto's unusual and adaptational DNA, and implants a Keystone inside of it, hoping to keep it always in the Mega state if they succeed. In order to prevent the Mewtwo mindwipe from happening again, Giovanni has the scientists perform gene-splicing experiments to induce a Dark Typing into the Ditto, and try to use subliminal messages to make Ditto go after Ash.

The experiment works, and a Mega Ditto is created, it is found unable to be recognized as a in the database due to the experiments, and Poké Balls have no effect. Unfortunately for them, the Mega Ditto isn't subservient to them, and hates them for the pain and torment they inflicted with the experiment. Also, due the experiments, the Mega Ditto, instead of targeting Ash as they intended, instead becomes obsessed with him romantically, to the point of becoming a Yandere. Mega Ditto shows it's traits as it absorbs several female members, then splits, and begins using them to destroy Team Rocket. After Team Rocket is destroyed, the Mega Ditto merges back all of its pieces, and goes off in search of Ash.

The Mega Ditto can absorb a girl by surrounding and consuming her, and can also do this to inanimate objects. Poké Balls themselves can't be absorbed, but going through the process turns the Pokémon into being loyal to the Mega Ditto. Mega Ditto is able to access the memories of any girl it has absorbed, and can reform into anything it has absorbed, but it can only work with the amount of mass it has at it's disposal, and the amount of any kind of substance. For example, if it absorbed Dawn and Cynthia, it could split and turn into both, or have both become Dawn, but unless it had more mass and human skin absorbed to make up for the difference in size, it couldn't have both become Cynthia. The Mega Ditto has a hive mind, and seeks to have Ash be its and its alone, and if it thinks Ash might want a girl, or thinks a girl's trying to get with Ash, it'll absorb her as well.

Story 13: Zorua replaces Dawn

Takes place at the end of the movie where Ash and friends help Zorua and Zoroark against Kodai, but things take a negative turn in the aftermath, as Zoroark dies of its wounds before Celebi can heal her, and Dawn ends up accidentally caught in the time ripple when Celebi leaves, with no one seeing except Zorua. Everyone looks for Dawn in the aftermath, but can't find her, with Zorua not telling what happened. Zorua decides to perfect its bizarre solid transformation, making it so it can hide its non-human traits, and the same powers Zoroark used for imitating the Legendary Beasts to make it look like it's talking in her voice until it can naturally learn to talk and imitating her scent.

Celebi returns to inform them of what happened, arriving in front of Zorua, who is the only one around, but Zorua convinces it to instead to lock itself in Dawn's form with its time based powers, but still able to age (characters age in this story, and Ash was about to turn 15 soon, and Dawn was 14, as are all of his long term female traveling companions seen so far in the anime, for us, not in universe, except for Misty, who is 16, and, of course, Bonnie). They do this so that nobody worries about Dawn, as she's lost in time, unlikely to every get back, as Celebi didn't see where or when she arrived, and Zorua just wanted to leave its life due to Zoroark's passing.

Celebi helps Zorua pretend to be Dawn, but acting like she has amnesia, acting like it found her and brought her back, as the new time ripple is found, with "Dawn" and Celebi there in front of it, with Zorua pretending only to have the memories to know Ash and Brock's names and that what happened with the events of the movie. It decides that Ash would be the ideal mate for a human girl, so it tells the two it "remembers" being in love with Ash.

Story 14: Princess Dawn, Coordinator Salvia

Like in Dawn of a Royal Day, but Salvia sneaks away instead of having Freesia meet the group, and finds Dawn, before she found out about the contest and said there was no point in joining, with her being separated from the others due to having to use the restroom. She convinces Dawn to switch places with her, and Salvia enters as her, but making sure to wear one of Dawn's dresses for the contest, instead of Dawn's regular outfit.

The two work to imitate each other's voices, and tell each other what they can in order to pretend to be each other, including Dawn giving her a rundown on what she'll need to know in order to fool Ash, Brock, and all three of their Pokémon, with none of the others, even the Pokémon, except for Salvia's Togekiss knowing the truth.

Dawn uses some perfume normally in this story, so Pikachu isn't able to notice the difference in smell, due to never smelling her without it. Salvia pretends to be Dawn, telling Ash and Brock that the princess gave her Togekiss due to it wanting to compete in contests, since she intends to give it to Dawn anyway. Afterwards, they are unable to swap back due to Dawn not being able to get away, due to security being tighter since Salvia snuck out, and Ash and friends have to head out.

That night, Salvia contacts Dawn using Dawn's Pokétch. Salvia has a cellphone she normally has on her that Dawn now has, since she has her contact information, at a time she knew Dawn would be alone due to her schedule. They decide to stay as each other, and giving each other any more info they would need in order to avoid anyone (especially Dawn's acquaintances) finding out, sending pictures to each other of everyone that stood to them, and info about them. Salvia decides to pursue Ash romantically, and not separate when he leaves Sinnoh. The aging for the characters is the same as the Zorua replaces Dawn storyline.

155341.content: Ok, before we get into this, SoraxKairi and RoxasxXion are going to be canon, but what about Naminé? She previously showed no feelings for Riku, and the only shipping related thing on his end was through his replica. It makes no sense how they suddenly seemed to love each other out of nowhere in Kingdom Hearts 3, so, will RikuxNaminé be a thing, or will Kairi and Naminé both be with Sora?
155341.title: Three Soras

1553412.content:
As she looked over her latest drawing, Namine sighed.

How many days had it been now? 3? 4? Honestly, it was a little hard to tell how much time passed these days. Not that these days were really anything to write home about. The young Nobody was on her own today, and by that even more alone than usual. Both DiZ and Riku were off taking care of other business today, leaving her to handle her tasks all on her own.

It was just a short while ago that Roxas had been put into a digital recreation of Twilight Town, following his defection from Organization XIII, and defeating his friend, Xion. Sadly, memories of the latter were already gone from him and pretty much everyone else. Namine imagined she was the only one who did remember her now, by virtue of her connection with Sora's memories. That was perhaps the one trace of Xion left, contained within Sora. Though who knows, maybe the fact that Roxas didn't remember having to kill her himself was a blessing in disguise.

Eh, she didn't know what to figure at this point. All she could do was continue her task, to set everything up for Roxas to eventually go back to Sora as well. Fun times. She knew as well as anyone that it was necessary, but it didn't make her feel any better about it. So, there she was, looking out the window of the mansion like she did a lot of the time.

"If only something else could be done." She muttered to no one in particular.

And then, as if hearing her....

"Perhaps I can offer something." Spoke a male voice.

Namine jumped a little, seeing a corridor of darkness appearing right in her room. Through it stepped a man dressed in a black coat. The coat immediately gave him away as a member of Organization XIII.

"Who are..." Namine started, sinking back into her seat a little. The girl had no experience actually dealing face to face with someone who could mean her harm.

"I'm Vexen," said the man, ranked Number IV in the Organization, pulling down his hood to reveal his face, his long blonde hair falling down his back. "I have some information that you might just find interesting."
1553412.title: Naminé paired with Riku

15534121.content:
Naminé's eyes widened further. She knew this man. He was one of those in Castle Oblivion, the one with the creepy laugh that was always ranting on and on about his experiments. He was almost even creepier than the guy with the pink hair and the woman who orchestrated the whole incident.

Not to mention, wasn't this guy defeated at Castle Oblivion.

"I...don't want to hear anything from you..." She spoke, trying to put on a brave face, though it was hard to hide her fear. Not like she had much of a way to defend herself.

"I'm aware that you might not be inclined to listen, given what happened at Castle Oblivion," Vexen said, as if this didn't bug him. "However, I assure you that you'll find this information most interesting."

Needless to say, Naminé wasn't buying it. Clutching her pad a little, she tried looking away from him. The Chilly Academic sighed, though he didn't seem surprised.

"I suppose words won't do much, and I very well can't harm you," He said, before snapping his fingers. "So perhaps these will suffice."

At that, three bursts of light appeared at Vexen's feet, blinding Naminé slightly. To say she was confused would be an understatement. Was he attacking her? Didn't sound like he wanted to, but what did she know. All she knew about these Organization members is that they valued her abilities. In any case, the light died down before too long, allowing Naminé to look. Once she did though, she got out of her seat.

"What?"

At Vexen's feet appeared to be three white dummy's. One probably wouldn't guess what it was upon seeing them for the first time, but Naminé had an idea. These....were replica bodies. Things she had known of from Castle Oblivion. She had previously become acquainted with one based on Riku's image, and of course, there was Xion.

"I presume I don't need to explain these." Vexen said nonchalantly.

"Well yes but.....why?" Naminé asked, utterly confused.

"I suppose I'll have to give you the full explanation." He sighed. "I suppose I should start with why I'm here. To start if off, I'm not the same Vexen you knew, but rather, a replica."

".....What?" she repeated.

"I, or rather the original Vexen, eagerly wanted to explore the details of replica technology. So, to do that, and in case anything happened to him, he made 44 replicas of himself, of which I'm one of. Of course, as you're aware of, the original met his end at Castle Oblivion, so as you can see, it was quite an intelligent maneuver to accomplish this."

Naminé couldn't help but notice the bit of smugness in that quote.

"In any case, following that, the other replicas and I continued working in secret. As time went on, we eventually started transferring ourselves into other replicas, giving us more to work with. Effectively, our experiences were merging together too, so it's not like anything was being lost. However, during the course of this, we began to realize something. I'm sure this isn't strange to you, but for us, it was startling when we realized we were beginning to feel emotions."

True, something like that wasn't strange to Naminé, given her nature. However, for someone like Vexen? That was very much new. She didn't speak a word and let him continue.

"At first, you would think we were just fooling ourselves, as we had been doing since the beginning. Yet....these emotions were actually true. The first we had felt since becoming Nobodies. This was against what Xemnas had told us, and while we had suspicions that he had a plot of his own, the fact that he lied in such a matter made it all the clearer that something was up. And so, having faced that realization, the other replicas and I changed course, trying to perfect our replicas for another matter."

Xemnas...the leader of the Organization. Naminé didn't know what the man looked like, though clearly there were those who didn't agree with him. Those two leaders at Castle Oblivion were indication of that.

"So, what are you saying?" Naminé said a little sternly. Honestly, she liked that it seemed like someone had a change of heart so to speak, but she wasn't entirely on board with him yet.

"To sum things up to where we are now, we were able to perfect three replica bodies, far more advanced than any we had accomplished before," Vexen then took a breath. "Although, it basically required we use up most of the bodies we had. I am now the only replica of Vexen left, after all the merges we did."

Was there....actually a twinge of regret in there? Naminé was pretty good at deciphering people's feelings in such a regard, which made her soften a bit. As bizarre as this was, perhaps he was truly meaningful.

"Okay....so what are you suggesting I do with these?" Naminé asked.

"Simple. These are for you, Roxas, and Xion."
15534121.title: Continue

155341211.content:
Naminé was so floored by what she just heard that she almost fell backwards into her seat. Her surprise was two-fold, one being the idea of these replicas being for her, Roxas, and Xion.

The other: how in the worlds did he remember Xion at all?

"How did you....?" Naminé started. However, Vexen seemed to have caught on to her latter thoughts.

"How do I remember Xion?" Vexen stated simply as opposed to asking. "I suppose you could consider it an incredible loophole. I only know Xion through the memories of the original Vexen. Furthermore, the knowledge of creating her wasn't lost, allowing me to retain memories of her."

The fact that he spoke so simply about it made it seem like not a bid deal, when it was anything but. For someone other than Naminé to retain memory of Xion in such a fashion was uncanny, and Naminé wasn't too sure how to feel about it. In a way, it was nice that the girl at least had someone to remember her....though this was not really the guy in mind.

Well, Naminé still wasn't sure how much of Vexen's story she could buy, but then again, there wasn't much incentive to lie to her at this point. History already showed that it didn't take much to force her into something. He could have easily just taken her if he wanted to, instead of just explaining everything.

"So, say I believe you about all this..." She said as she took a breath. "What do you expect me to to do now?"

"For the time being, the same thing as you've been doing: repairing Sora." Vexen stated. He couldn't help the smarmy grin on his face as Naminé looked a little alarmed. "That shouldn't surprise you. I knew you were here didn't I? Figuring out where you were and what you were up to was a simple task once I started my plans."

Naminé's head was beginning to spin. Just how much did this guy figure out? It was almost terrifying in a way, since if he did know as much as it seemed, and didn't have somewhat noble intentions, he could have leaked her to the rest of the Organization.

"Fine, and what else?" She asked, knowing there was more.

"To put it simply, as you're working on Sora, connect Roxas and Xion to these replicas. That shouldn't be a problem for you as Xion has already returned to Sora and his connection with Roxas should allow you to connect them as well. I am aware that you have Roxas in your possession as well at the moment." Vexen explained. "In any case, by doing that, their memories should end up getting siphoned from Sora into the replicas, without any harm to Sora himself."

"But how would they actually return?" asked Namine, perplexed.

"That I'm a little less clear on, but I hypothesize that a strong emotional connection should be able to release them. What you're doing would essentially be leaving a door open for them to leave Sora and into the replicas." said Vexen.

Naminé thought on it for a second. It made sense, and doing that was well within her power. However....

"But what would bring Xion back? Her case isn't the same as Roxas's." She said.

"True, but Roxas likely retains at least some level of memories of her, even if he is unaware." said Vexen. "Sora really doesn't have to do a thing. Roxas would likely bring Xion along with him. Don't you believe so?"

Honestly, it was quite plausible. Since Naminé had full access to Xion's memories that were now inside Sora, she could see everything Xion valued from beginning to end. There was no doubt that her bond with Roxas was strong, and with that red-head Axel as well. Course, Naminé did wonder if them remembering their ultimate farewell would have lasting effects on them.

"I believe you would be right," Naminé said finally. "And if I'm doing that, what will you be doing?"

"I'll prepare your replica." said Vexen, and just hearing the idea of being in a replica made Naminé flinch a little. "Once the replicas are done and Roxas is ready to return, we'll have you go to Kairi on Destiny Islands to reunite with her."

"I'm not sure that will go so well." Naminé said with a sigh. "Riku sometimes told me of how his own memories of Sora got worse as the year went on. Chances are it's probably just as bad for Kairi. She might not remember Sora at all for all I know."

"I would presume that won't be much of a problem once Sora is returned to normal." Vexen countered. "Even I can't say how long it would take for those closest to him will remember everything, but I doubt it would be long. Chances are, you shouldn't have any problems returning to Kairi. Once that's done, preparations can be made to bring you back."

This all sounded so convoluted. So much stuff going on to try and bring the three of them back. Course, it wasn't like Naminé didn't like the idea. The thought of actually being able to help more delighted her honestly. A way to make up for what happened in the past year.

So, there really wasn't much of a decision to make here.

"Alright fine." She said, a little more resolute now. "Let's get started then."

"Marvelous." Vexen said with a grin.
155341211.title: Continue

1553412111.content:
From that point onwards, things continued....relatively normally.

There actually wasn't too much interaction between the two, as it wasn't too necessary to complete their work. Despite some hesitance, Naminé didn't need assistance hooking Sora up with the two replicas. Much to her joy, there weren't any notable negative effects to her doing so, giving her hope that this could actually be pulled off. Somehow, she was able to work on that as well as repairing Sora's memories at the same time, all while under Diz and Riku's nose. Thankfully neither of the two delved too deep into her personal matters as long as she was working. Not like DiZ really cared about her well being or anything the way she saw it.

She wasn't quite sure where Vexen went off to with the replica for her. In fact, the situation with Kairi almost worried her even more. As the days went on, while she was confident Roxas' situation would be resolved with as little pain as possible, Kairi was another matter. Naminé couldn't help but wonder how she was. Did she even remember Sora at this point? She had hoped her continuing repairs to Sora's memories would alleviate that, but she couldn't say for sure. Guess it was something she wouldn't know until she met Kairi herself.

In any case, she had the replicas fully set up by the 7th day Roxas had been in the digital Twilight Town, and had them carefully hidden away so they wouldn't be harmed. Vexen had briefly told her the other day that soon enough he'd come back to take Naminé to Kairi though he didn't say when. Now it was basically just a waiting game for Roxas to come.

At least these days hadn't been boring. She had been going into the simulation herself, having conversations with Roxas and slowly revealing more of the truth, at least as much as she was able before interruptions. Still, she was determined for him to see why rejoining with Sora was a good thing. Heck, she had already believed that before an opportunity was presented for Sora to be whole again yet have everyone else be able to live their own lives.

It was kind of funny in a way. Thinking on it, Naminé wasn't too sure what she'd do with a life of her own. After all, she lived with the thought that she was just Kairi and that her life and Kairi's were meant to be one and the same. And yet, the two could possibly live as separate people now. Naminé could be whatever she wanted.....whatever that was. Guess that was something she'd have to figure out later.

In any case, she knew Roxas was on approach to the mansion right now. The time was coming.

"Is this really going to work?" She wondered to herself.

She had hoped to be there to meet Roxas at the mansion in the digital world, but instead there was a data version of her, probably there by DiZ to make sure Roxas kept going. Well, she at least hoped she could have a say in it. She'd make sure she'd tell Roxas whatever he needed to know, even if DiZ couldn't care less what he learned.

In any case, as Roxas approached the digital mansion, everything was set to begin.
1553412111.title: Continue

15534121111.content:
Needless to say, Roxas hadn't been having the most conventional week. First, he was just enjoying summer with his friends: Hayner, Pence, and Olette. Things were nice, doing silly things like Struggle, and discovering the 7 Wonders and all that stuff. Things you would be doing with your buddies on vacation. And yet, things had been turned upside down rather quickly. Now, he wasn't sure. Ever since the big sword shaped like a key appeared to him, so many weird things had been happening, and in the latest string of weird occurances, he had been beckoned to come to the mansion by some weird guy, after getting attacked....again.

And that's what lead him to here, using said key to unlock the door to the mansion while those weird white squiggly things were coming after him. Actually, he had wondered why they didn't immediately follow him as he went through the gate, but whatever.

"Wow....it's even bigger on the inside." Roxas murmured to himself.

Indeed, the mansion was pretty expansive, and very rundown too. Splinters of wood were everywhere, stuff thrown there and everywhere, etc. It was a real mess so to speak. In any case, Roxas knew he was here for a reason, so now he just needed to go find it. Hopefully that place where he met Naminé should be around here somewhere. Then he could finally get his answers, particularly into this "Nobody" and "Sora" business that had been plaguing him for days.

Of course, it wasn't easier. Coming into the mansion, more of those weird things kept coming, along with a different kind that looked similar yet was larger and featured numerous blades on it. Thankfully, he was good enough with the key to get through them relatively unharmed, nothing he couldn't get through anyway.

"Nice welcoming party." He said sarcastically, tearing through yet another batch of the weirdos.

Eventually, upon looking through many doors on the upper floor, a burst of light caught his eye. Ah, there it was. The room where Naminé was. Finally, he could make some headway, and get some answers. The room was as clean as it was before though, and eerily quiet. Looking inside, Roxas couldn't see Naminé anywhere.

"Naminé?" he called out, getting no answer.

He began to look through the room, seeing what he could find around. What happened afterwards would only be described as a whirlwind of emotions, plus a little headache. A particular picture that Namine clearly drew caught Roxas's interest, and subsequently had his head hurting at the sight of it. Roxas had had no shortage of headaches over the course of the week, but this one was particularly noteworthy. Now he knew who that Axel guy was, and where exactly he and Roxas came from. Many of the pieces were coming together....

"Ugh...." Roxas groaned.

Right then though, he felt a presence behind him, sitting in a seat at the other side of the room. Didn't take a genius to figure out who, and said person probably already knew what he had just seen.

"Organization XIII....they're a bad group." Roxas said.

"Bad, or good, I don't know. They're a group of incomplete people who wish to be whole." Naminé said. "To that end, they're desperately searching for something."

"What?" Roxas inquired, finding all of this pretty believable now all things considered.

"Kingdom Hearts." Naminé replied, and was subsequently put off by a little chuckle from Roxas. "Funny?"

"It's just, I think....I've been running away from the question I really want to ask: What's gonna happen to me now?" Roxas asked, gripping the edge of the table, a sliver of sorrow in his voice. "Just tell me that. Nothing else really matters anymore."

Naminé seemed to not give any sort of emotional response to that, simply saying "You are....."

Right then, her figure flickered, catching Roxas off-guard as her body seemed to disintegrate into data, a phenomenon he felt was all too familiar these days.

"Naminé!" He cried out, before her body completely vanished.

So, was she fake? It was hard for him to say. Nothing seemed to make sense anymore. However, he had little time to actually process the information, as that same data phenomenon happened again, with a man in black and red appearing.

"There is no knowledge that has the power to change your fate." His deep voice boomed.

Not particularly liking the strange man's tone, Roxas replied with a stern look. "Even if it doesn't, I wanna know. I have the right to know!"

"A Nobody doesn't have the right to know. Nor does it even have the right to be." The man said back without missing a beat, almost as if dismissing Roxas's words entirely.

"But what IS a Nobody?!" Roxas yelled back, frustrated. Nobody this, Nobody that! What in the world did that even mean? For all everyone talked about, they sure weren't being helpful.

Suddenly, right out of the darkness, a large cloaked man appeared, startling Roxas a little.

"DiZ, we're out of time. Too many Nobodies!" Came the deep voice of the man to the one called DiZ.

And then, once again, another portal of darkness appeared. Just when Roxas was wondering who else could be joining this, there stood Naminé. The real one, hopefully.

"Roxas. Nobodies like us are only half a person!" Naminé said, finally hoping to get off her chest what she wanted to say. "You won't disappear. You'll be whole! And...."

Oh did she want to say more. How she wanted to tell Roxas how they would all be able to hopefully be their own person again. How he would be reunited with Xion, the girl he was forced to eliminate himself. She wanted to disclose everything to him. However, she caught herself. Spilling them in DiZ's presence would bring more trouble, and possibly even disrupt their plans. Naminé worried that they'd find where she hid the replicas for Roxas and Xion if she said more.

"I'll.....disappear....?" Roxas questioned, not liking the sound of that.

"No further outbursts!" DiZ announced, beginning to walk towards Naminé.

Right at that moment however, much to the chagrin of most in the room, yet another corridor of darkness appeared next to the one Naminé came out of. However, everyone looked surprised at this. DiZ questioned who this could be, while the dark-robed man seemed to flinch oh so slightly.

"Oh what now?!" Roxas yelled out. Seriously, he was kind of getting tired of this.

"Show a little gratitude." A smarmy voice came as Vexen emerged from his corridor, grabbing Naminé immediately. "Apologies for the tardiness. Needed to sort out a few more things before I arrived."

"Vexen!" DiZ exclaimed, now visibly disturbed. "How are you here?!"

"Those answers are for another day." Vexen replied. "Suffice to say, I'm filling the role of the good scientist for a day."

"Ansem!" DiZ wasted no time in dealing with Vexen's words. "Eliminate him! Naminé too if that's what it takes!"

The dark-robed man, apparently named Ansem, brandished an odd dark-looking sword, Soul Eater, in his hand, lunging towards Vexen instantly. Unperturbed, Vexen materialized his Frozen Pride shield, blocking the sword attack, emitting a little shockwave form the impact. Vexen's other arm was wrapped around Naminé.

"NO, you won't disappear!" Naminé cried out against Vexen's grasp as he continued to black Ansem's sword strikes. "Roxas, we'll meet again!"

What more could she say? What could she say to him now that would help assure him? Not much she could think of in the heat of the moment came to mind. Still, going with what just "felt" right, she smiled gently.

"Just....know everything will be alright!" She said. "Just know that!"

"Okay, time's up!" Vexen said, starting to buckle under Ansem's strength. "Moving on to the next phase."

Just like that, he vanished into the dark corridor he emerged from, leaving DiZ and Ansem a little bewildered. Roxas was more concerned with Namine though.

"Naminé!" He cried out, her form already long gone from here.

"How did they know she was here? Blast it!" DiZ growled a little. "Ansem, we may need to take certain measures."

Roxas couldn't tell what was being said between the two men, but eventually DiZ left through the dark corridor Naminé originally came from, while Ansem wisped out instantly, leaving the room as empty and silent as before.

"What....What is going on?" Roxas mumbled, his mind going in all sorts of directions now.

He came to get answers, and he had some now. However, it was like a whole new page of questions opened as well.
15534121111.title: Continue

155341211111.content:
In another part of the Mansion

"You can't be serious." Ansem told DiZ incredulously. "You would have had Naminé eliminated anyway?"

"Indeed," DiZ spoke as casually as before. "Re-completing Sora was the prime objective. There would have been no use for Naminé once that was completed."

To say Ansem was angry would be an understatement, although he hid it well, the only indication being a slight tightening of his fist. The two had gone to another part of the mansion following the incident in Namine's room. Ansem immediately asked what would be next. Despite some initial grimacing, DiZ continued on with the casual indifference he usually conducted himself with.

"Vexen somehow reappearing was unexpected however. I presume you will want do discover where he's gone with her." DiZ said. "For me, all that matters is Sora's return. Roxas appears to be heading his way right now. That's what you wanted, correct? You only intended to work with me until Sora was re-completed."

"Yes...." Ansem said in a low voice. "But still...."

"This is beyond my reach. All I will do now is continue what I would have done regardless," Diz spoke again, turning his back towards Ansem. "I believe you should dispose of Naminé whenever you find her, but do as you wish."

Ansem couldn't tell for certain just what DiZ was thinking. It sounded like he really wanted Naminé gone, yet this unexpected turn didn't disturb him too much. Either way, it made him angry just thinking about it. Who was he to think he had the right to choose someone's fate like that? Naminé was a person, regardless if she was a Nobody. Even if she had done some misguided things over the past year, that was no reason to toss her aside like garbage.

Still, as DiZ whisked away from their location, Ansem thought about his next move. At the very least, he needed to find Naminé to make sure she was safe. Vexen was hardly a man to be trusted, and how in the worlds was he alive to begin with? He needed answers, and reassurance that Naminé was in good hands.

With that, he whisked away himself into a corridor of darkness.

Destiny Islands

A corridor of darkness appeared along the beaches of Destiny Islands, with Naminé and Vexen stepping out of it and into the bright skies above. Naminé needed a little time to catch her breath, though, from her sudden "kidnapping" from the mansion.

"I know... you said you'd be back..." Naminé sighed as she caught her breath. "... but that was really close."

"I haven't exactly been sitting around all day you know." Vexen stated plainly. "Getting everything set up in Hollow Bastion took time. I'd be lying if I said there weren't perhaps a complication or two. It's been years since the last time I set foot in that place."

Naminé could sense something from Vexen's tone there. Did that have something to do when he was still complete, or in his case, when his original was? She decided not to press about it. Honestly, she was quite enamored with what she was seeing here. Being part of Kairi, originally and seeing Sora's memories, she knew all about Destiny Islands. However, nothing could compare to actually experiencing it with her own senses. Kind of made her wonder if it would feel like this when she had her own body. Guess only time would tell.

"It's so beautiful here." She smiled, looking at the waves crashing upon the shore.

"Eh, it's nature. What of it." Vexen dismissed off-handedly. "I also took notice of Kairi's condition from time to time, but I would imagine you already know that."

"Yes." Naminé nodded, smiling a little. "And Roxas actually came into contact with Kairi a little while ago. Sora's heart even got to speak to her and she was able to remember him, at least better than before."

"Good. That should save a little time on explaining." Vexen nodded. "Best we get this over with quickly. With that little scene back there, I'd rather not linger around."

"Riku......" Naminé muttered to herself.

She wondered what he could be doing now. He followed DiZ's command to attack, but that was likely also fueled by the desire to protect her from Vexen. Now, she hoped with Sora coming back soon, that would ease Riku's torment if only a little. Well, first things first, she now had to prepare herself for a step of her own to take....

Somewhere in the darkness

Time seemed to have lost all meaning for Xion of late. How long had it been? Hours? Days? Weeks? Hard to tell in the darkness. Xion's mind often wandered back and forth between murky and a little bit of clarity. Kind of like being underwater all the time. One moment she remembered things, and then the next it slipped her mind. At the least, she could remember why she was here, and she didn't have a problem with that.

"Roxas…" Her mouth moved to make the word, though practically inaudible.

Where was he now? Twilight Town? Was he okay? Was Axel okay too? Questions came and went in her mind. There were moments when it felt like she could get a clear glimpse of the one she was connected to, but then it was like going right back underwater. Still, there was....a feeling, that he was getting closer somehow.....somehow....it was a warm sensation.

For a split second, she could see him. Him being at the mansion where Sora slept....yet the clarity passed as she was taken under once again.

The Mansion

Suffice to say, Roxas wasn't happy....at all.

Sure, he finally found a way into the mansion's basement, which he had walked down almost immediately. He was standing in front of a computer, likely used for that whole simulation or whatever it was. With everything that just came to mind for him, his mood was sour. Not just how Naminé was treated right in front of him, and he was concerned for her whereabouts now, but for the other things that were coming to mind.

"Riku...." He grumbled to himself.

Yeah, now he remembered. Riku was the big-hooded man, because he transformed as they fought in The World That Never Was. He wondered why he was following the orders of that mysterious man, though frankly the reasons mattered little to him at the moment. Roxas was typically rather cool-headed, but he was feeling something completely different: anger. Anger for what he had been going through this past week, getting told he didn't have a right to know who he was. It was frustrating.

"Grrrrr....AHHHHH!" Roxas cried out, throwing his hands in the air before drawing his keyblade.

Yeah, the keyblade. That's what it was called. A power everyone said belonged to his other half. Sora this. Sora that. That's all it seemed to be. A means to an end. As much as Roxas had this sense that he was doing what he needed to do, it was still frustrating. And it was with that frustration that he unleashed his keyblade upon the computer, smashing it with every fiber of his being. Just looking at it reminded him of that red man.

"I...hate... this!" He said, finally allowing himself to breathe, after leaving the computer a wreck.

Over to the side, he could hear a door opening. Catching his breath, he took that as a sign to keep going. A firm look upon his face, he kept on walking, eager to see just where this would lead.
155341211111.title: Continue

1553412111111.content:
Awaiting in the next room for Roxas were just more Nobodies, which he had to admit were kind of getting repetitive at this point, almost like someone was messing with him. Still, as he cut down every one that came at him, he had an idea of who was probably behind it. After all, a certain Organization member appeared often in this simulated Twilight Town, and now Roxas knew who exactly was doing it.

And he didn't have to wait long for a confirmation.

"Simply amazing, Roxas." Another black-robed man, sporting wild red hair and a cocky demeanor, walked in.

"Axel." Roxas spoke simply, no longer in doubt as who he was talking to.

"You really do remember me this time?" Axel spoke in a tone that seemed to be between satisfaction and mockery. Both however disappeared as flames began to erupt around him. "I'm SO FLATTERED!"

The flames burst all around Axel, surrounding Roxas as well in a circle of flame within the room. Roxas could tell this meant no escaping from this battle. Roxas admittedly didn't know how far Axel's powers went, as he rarely needed to show off big attacks during their many missions hunting Heartless. Axel was truely taking this fight seriously.

"But you're too late!!!" Axel cried out once more, the flames burning even more intensely.

His battle instincts taking over, Roxas took this opportunity to finally unveil another thing that had come back along with memory. After all, there was a reason he got as far as he did before he got captured: an ability he awoke too somehow not too long ago. Honestly, he wasn't even sure why he had such a power, but who was he to complain. Just using that same little Keyblade he had been using up until now was small-time compared to what he had now.

Bright lights appeared in both hands this time, his Synch Blade power activating. To the left awoke a white angelic blade that glowed many colors and radiated promise: Oathkeeper. To the right, a demonic blade which seemed emanate dark feelings and pain: Oblivion.

"Two?!" Axel asked incredulously, before reaching out and summoning out of flame his own chakrams: Eternal Flames.

Gripping his blades tightly, Roxas faced down Axel. He had a feeling now as to why Axel was after him, but that being the case he knew he couldn't allow it to happen. Chances were Axel knew that as well. He wondered if Axel would hold back at all. It was kind of hard to tell how the Flurry of Dancing Flames (so he was called on occasion) would react at any given moment. Although, it didn't take long for an answer.

"Come here, I'll make it all stop!" Axel said with a snear, his chakrams beginning to light up even more. "Burn, baby!"

Axel opened up the fight sending flames across the ground at Roxas, which weren't too hard for him to dodge. Of course, both combatants were pretty quick on their feet, and it wasn't too long before all four weapons were clashing, each trying to push the other back. All of Roxas's attention was focused on defeating Axel, as it was evident with the first strike that Axel was hitting him hard.

"You're not getting cold feet are ya?" Axel smirked, bringing his left chakram around. "I'd suggest you fight on as if your life depended on it!"

"I don't need you to tell me that!" Roxas crossed both blades to block the attack.

The force of the blow pushed him back into the wall of flames, which he bounced right off of. Thank goodness for magical ability to walk on flames. Roxas pushed back into Axel, striking him with some blows before Axel was able to jump back. As Roxas charged him though, Axel jumped even further back, going into the flames. Roxas gasped a little as Axel disappeared into them, completely hiding his presence. He hadn't seen this before. So Axel really was hiding tricks up his sleeves.

"HAH!" A cry from behind startled Roxas he just narrowly avoided taking major damage from behind, still he still ended up a little singed from Axel's attack. "You're terrible at defending your backside, ya know? Did I ever tell you that?"

"I don't know... why don't you jog my memory?" Roxas spat back rhetorically as he swung Oblivion around Axel's feet, getting in a good blow. "I seem to recall you always letting Heartless sweep you off your feet."

Axel smirked again as he re-balanced, resulting into another clash of melee blows with Roxas. "So you think you got me all memorized huh? Points for actually paying attention."

The impact forced them both back, as Axel covered the floor in fire once again. Roxas groaned a little as he did, knowing that would only harm him if he stayed in one place too long. Guess Axel wanted to keep the fight moving at a wild pace. Fine with him if that was what it took.

Still, something gnawed at Roxas the more he fought. Particularly his thoughts towards his Keyblades. Oathkeeper and Oblivion, pretty distinctive even as far as Keyblades went. Roxas remembered using a variety of them during his time in the Organization, but these stood out in particular. A part of him told him that they must have something to do with Sora, if what everyone kept telling him had any significance. However, it was like there was more to it, particularly with Oblivion. Honestly, something about it made him tremble slightly. He recognized it as not a Keyblade he had used beforehand, compared to Oathkeeper anyway. Additionally, this was the Keyblade he threw to Riku back then.

Why was that? Why did he do such a thing? Why did this particular blade give him pause? For some reason, just thinking on it caused him some level of discomfort.....

"What did I say, about LETTING YOUR GUARD DOWN?!"

Axel's booming voice brought Roxas out of his brief stupor, and for good reason. Axel was spinning his chakrams alight with flames, and merging them into a single large chakram that caked the room in light. Now this was something Roxas was familiar with. Explosion was Axel's own limit break, and this was his big finisher. Roxas noticed just in time to see the giant weapon coming towards him, holding Oblivion up to guard.

The resounding clash bombarded the room with light.

Somewhere in the darkness

For a moment, Xion felt like something just lit up in her head. Granted, she had had this odd sensation for a while now (days maybe?) but this was new. What was going on? It sounded like... fighting... and a really intense one at that....

"What's.....going on....?" She tried to say to herself.

Fire....so much of it....and two familiar figures... one wielding two Keyblades while the other was alight with flames. For the briefest of moments, Xion had full sight of those two, weapons clashing furiously.

"Roxas... Axel....why are you fighting?" She wondered aloud. "No... PLEASE STOP!"

This... was just like before. Axel fighting to bring one of them back. Why did this have to keep on happening? Seeing the one she was connected to fighting her other best friend was too much to watch.

"Please... you don't have to do this... Roxas... Axel... Please..."

If she could reach her hand out, she would have. Yet, the familiar sensation of being pulled back under came back, making her awareness murky again. If only she could... just a second longer...

The Mansion

PLEASE STOP!

Roxas heard those words pass through his head faster than he had the chance to process it. He was nearly out of breath after Axel's strike.

"What was..." He tried to ask.

However, it wasn't long before he felt sucker-punched, Axel dealing a direct blow to his gut, sending him sprawling to the ground. Thankfully he kept his Keyblades in hand. As Roxas got back up, he could have sworn he saw a twitch in Axel's face for some reason, like something was up. Still, if there was, Axel wouldn't say.

"You going to make it that easy for me?" He asked. "Orders are to either bring you back or eliminate you. Frankly I'd rather not go with the latter."

Shaking his head, Roxas got back up. For some reason, that sensation he just felt wouldn't go away. All he knew was that it made him feel uncomfortable. This had to end fast. Axel had to be more tired than he was letting on.

"Fine, then I'll end it," Roxas said cooly.

His head clear, Roxas once again engaged Axel, being able to keep up easier than he did before. Perhaps he was finally getting more used to this style of fighting, but whatever the case, it worked for him. Axel's movements were slowing down. Seeing his opportunity, Roxas began tapping into his own light powers, finally having a chance to use those.

"HAH!"

Roxas finally parried Axel's attacks away, getting a clear shot to surround Axel with pillars of light. Before Axel knew it, he was bombarded with each pillar, sending him sprawling to the ground, struggling to get back up. Roxas took a breath and readied himself just in case, but the fires around the room began to cool down, signaling an end to the fight.

Roxas watched as Axel slowly brought himself back up, chakrams still in hand but clearly in no shape to continue. Roxas watched him cooly, recalling the last moments he had with Axel before leaving for good. Even then, Axel cared about his well-being. That had to be why as serious as Axel took this, Roxas knew he would win.

"Axel..." He said.

"Hey..." Axel sighed, still catching his breath. "Let's meet again, in the next life."

"Yeah. I'll be waiting." Roxas replied just as cooly. At that, Axel started chuckling.

"Silly... Just because you have a next life..." Axel said as darkness began to surround him.

Before long, Axel had vanished, leaving Roxas alone in the mansion once again.
1553412111111.title: Continue

15534121111111.content:
A corridor opened up atop Twilight Town's Clock Tower. Staggering pretty much the whole way, Axel ended up falling against the wall to his back, sliding down as he tried to catch his breath.

"Dang... that was quite the match." He chuckled, despite the pain. "Who'd have thought he could put up that much of a fight."

Then again, Roxas always did seem to be special. He'd already done many things no one else in the Organization could have done. He should've figured a serious fight with Roxas would end up taking all his energy one way or another. Kind of made him proud of the little guy he had watched over since his arrival a year ago.

However, there was another thing on Axel's mind. During that fight, something odd happened. As much as Axel got on Roxas's case for letting his guard down, there was a point where he felt something odd too. When his limit break clashed against Roxas, he got these brief images, mostly of him and Roxas on the Clock Tower. That was nothing strange of course, as he thought about those days often. Yet, for a brief moment, he felt like he could see a third black coat sitting with them. A figure that was perhaps a little smaller than Roxas, maybe a girl. He couldn't tell for sure. The instant passed before he could process it, leaving him wondering just what it was.

"Ugh, I truly do have all the icky jobs." He sighed, resigning himself to regaining his energy before moving forward. At least the scenery was nice as usual.

In the Mansion

Since Roxas exited the room he fought Axel in, he had been pondering similar thoughts. Now that he had time to think about it, it sounded like a girl's voice. Actually, come to think of it, it kind of sounded like Kairi, given he already knew what she sounded like from a while ago. Yet, something told him that wasn't the right answer. It was kind of confusing. All he could say for sure was that thinking about it gave him a nagging feeling that things just weren't right.

"I'm really starting to get tired of not knowing things." He sighed.

After walking for a bit, he came across numerous pods. Two of them held Donald and Goofy, who he also remembered from Sora. Guess they were in a similar state at the moment. That aside, the corridor continued onwards, so Roxas continued on his way. After going through another door though, he was greeted with a lit-up room that reminded him of Naminé's room a little. Immediately, he saw a giant pod in the middle, but he also saw DiZ in front of it.

Wonderful... just who Roxas wanted to see next. If the man noticed any such feelings from Roxas, he didn't show it.

"At last, the Keyblade's chosen one." DiZ spoke.

"Who are you talking to? Me?" Roxas spat, more than done with this man by now. "Or Sora?"

"To half of Sora, of course." DiZ replied. "You reside in darkness. What I need is someone who can move about the realm of light, and destroy Organization XIII."

"Why? Who are you?" Roxas asked, not seeing much of a problem with the man's objective, though his methods could use some work.

"I am a servant of the world." DiZ replied, giving a chuckle that almost sounded like amusement and despair mixed together. "And, if I'm a servant, then you should consider yourself a tool. at best."

Okay, Roxas had just reached how much crud he could take from this guy. His hands twitched with the desire to shut this guy up by any means necessary.

"Was that... Was that supposed to be a joke?" Roxas spat with barely concealed anger, Kingdom Key forming in his hand. "Cause I'm not laughing!"

Having had it with him, Roxas charged forth, eager to give him a piece of his mind. However, much to his disappointment, what should have been a clean blow ended up going through DiZ, data whirling around the area Roxas struck.

"My apologies. This is only a data-based projection." DiZ replied casually.

Not particularly caring, Roxas continued to strike DiZ, getting the same result each time. Roxas cried in frustration, striking the projection over and over again. Eventually, what energy Roxas still had after fighting Axel began to wane, and the projection teleported away, before taunting him and appearing behind him. Was there anything else this guy could do to tick him off?

"I hate you so much..." Roxas spat at him.

"You should share some of that hatred with Sora." DiZ replied, a slight smirk forming on his lips. "He's far too nice for his own good."

"No! My heart belongs to me! No one else!" Roxas cried right back, before striking DiZ again.

It only got the same result as before, although the projection didn't return this time. Instead, the pod came to life, its inner contents finally being shown to the world. Roxas knew what was coming, Sora's name uttering from his mouth as he laid guys on his original for the very first time. For a second, Roxas internally chuckled. For all that talk about originals and Nobodies and such, they really didn't look alike at all. Plus, his clothes were amusingly small for his body. Well, didn't seem to matter now. The moment of truth was here.

"You're lucky..." He said solemnly, already beginning to feel what was coming next. "Looks like my summer vacation is... over."

Destiny Islands

"So you know who DiZ is?" Naminé asked in surprise.

"Oh I knew him for a long time." Vexen replied with a chuckle. "I only wish I had more time at the mansion to gloat in his face about how far he's fallen. I've got some words for him I want to share."

Naminé actually giggled softly at that. Sounds like there was quite a history there. She'd love to hear it honestly. Compared to the months of having to deal with his indifference to her, Vexen actually proved to be entertaining, if not a little creepy, company. The sun was beginning to set, casting the Destiny Islands in an orange glow.

Right then though, Naminé felt something go off in her head, causing her to smile widely. She could tell, the deed was finally done. Sora was complete once more, with everything returned to where it needed to be. Roxas had gone back as they had hoped. Vexen immediately caught on to her change in demeanor.

"I presume he's finally done it?" Vexen asked.

"Yes. Sora's finally complete." Naminé smiled. "So...now Roxas and Xion will be able to come back without hurting him, right?"

"In theory, yes." Vexen said, seemingly pleased with the progress made so far. "The Replica bodies are ready for the both of them. All that should be necessary now is a strong reaction to fully bring them back. Even I can't say what that would entail, but that should sort itself out in time."

"I see..." Naminé said, hoping it would turn out as he said.

"And it seems to be not a moment too soon." Vexen said as he turned his head. "Our own objective is here at last."

Naminé turned in Vexen's direction, and her smile came back at seeing her original approaching the beach. Kairi had changed out of her school uniform for the day, walking down in a pink outfit. You could tell her eyes were set on the ocean, obviously wondering as to just where her friends, especially Sora, were.

As Kairi approached the beach however, she took notice of the two other occupants.

"Oh I'm sorry. I didn't see..." Kairi smiled an apology before getting a better look at the two people.

Seeing an older-looking guy in a black coat was pretty weird. That had to be really hot to wear in this climate. However, the bigger point was the girl. She looked... a lot like her! The hair was completely different, but the face could totally be her twin. As if sensing the bizarre predicament, Naminé walked closer to her and smiled.

"Kind of funny seeing another person with your face, right?" Naminé said, her smile not wavering. "Trust me, there's a reason for it."

"Oh... okay..." Kairi nodded slowly.

She wasn't sure why, but she guessed it worth hearing what this blonde-haired girl wanted to say. Chances are it wasn't a coincidence.

Twilight Town Station

At Twilight Town's train station, a particularly odd train was coming in. It was decked out in blue and gold colors, with numerous stars on it. Even more curious was its lone occupant, a really small being dressed all in black. Wearing a coat similar to that of the Organization, Mickey took a deep breath, ready to continue his investigation.

"Mickey." A deep voice spoke from the side.

The particular voice he just heard startled Mickey a little, even making him draw his Kingdom Key D. However, a quick look over to the black cloaked being, wielding a familiar sword, calmed Mickey down quickly.

"Phew, startled me for a second there, Riku." Mickey smiled as he dispelled his Keyblade. "Seems like things haven't been easy for ya. Anything new?"

"Plenty of things actually." Ansem, or rather, Riku spoke, still fully hidden underneath the cloak. In his hand was a munny pouch, which he'd intended to give to Sora through Mickey. However, things were more complicated now. "I hate to take up more of your time, but something urgent has come up."

"Riku, no time with you is ever wasted time." Mickey said encouragingly. "Still, this sounds pretty serious. What's up?"

"Well, you see..."

The Mansion's Basement

"Sora!"

The voices came from two different sources: one being high while the other was pretty deep. Both voices were familiar to Sora, helping him to wake up finally and stretch his limbs out. Such actions caused laughing from his two companions, making him groan indignantly before jumping out.

"Donald! Goofy!"

At long last, the three of them were back, even if they weren't quite sure just how long they were out. Then again, it didn't really matter.
15534121111111.title: Continue

155341211111111.content:
The next few minutes between Sora, Donald, and Goofy were spent hashing things out and figuring what they were up to. Of course, they were joined by their trusty companion, Jiminy Cricket, as well. They had recounted their prior adventures, and what they were up to following defeating Ansem. Sadly, that's where the familiarity seemed to end.

It only got more bizarre that Jiminy's journal didn't anything in it but the words "Thank Naminé." That name sounded vaguely familiar to Sora, but that was as far as that went. Donald took the chance to mention how useless the journal was, to which Jiminy looked a little flustered. In turn, he suggested that they instead go and find out where they were, to no objections.

Sora wasn't sure why, but it felt like he had been asleep for a while. At least, he had a feeling he had been. Taking a nap was one thing, but he was never this stiff before. The building they woke up in was pretty spacious, if not falling apart. The scenery outside was pretty nice, though all of it was giving Sora a weird case of deja vu. The feeling didn't fade as they approached the nearby town. He even mentioned to his pals that it seemed familiar, but upon pressing from Donald, he couldn't add any more to it.

Still, in any case, the town was quite lively. Sora liked it a lot. Kind of felt like home in a strange way. Along the way, though, he came across a spot where he met some kids: Hayner, Pence, and Olette. Again, there was a little familiarity with them, but in any case they were nice enough. One of them though, Pence, mentioned someone looking for them after they introduced themselves: someone wearing a black coat and sporting big round ears. Such a distinctive image gave them all an easy answer: King Mickey.

Twilight Town Station

"What?!" Mickey cried out, louder than he intended. "Organization XIII got Naminé?!"

"Well, Vexen did in any case," Riku sighed with noticeable distress in his tone. "I'm still not even sure how he's even around."

"I thought he'd been defeated too. Guess you can never tell with these guys." Mickey said. "You think they have her in their possession now?"

"That's what gets me." Riku said. "If they found out that's where Naminé was, why send Vexen? They'd have a much easier time with using one of the higher ups to grab her. Plus, his words seemed off to me now that I think about it. He talked like he was finally doing good or something like that."

"Hmm....you're right how it's weird that he's the one who happened to get her." Mickey nodded. "Well, in any case, we should try to rescue her, or at the least try to discover Vexen's intentions."

"That's what I wanted to ask about." Riku said, turning to Mickey. "I think one of us should go try to find her. Honestly, I'd like to do it myself but..."

He truly did want to go look for her. Despite everything that happened, Naminé was a good person, and he had to admit, she was kind of a source of relief over the course of the year. She could be melancholy, but he could tell she definitely had Kairi's spirit. It was part of how he kept himself motivated all this time, even when his own memories of Sora were affected. Helping her in her time of need after everything she helped him with was something he really wanted to do. Still...

"There's keeping an eye on Sora too." Mickey guessed correctly, smiling as Riku didn't give an answer. "That makes sense. I wouldn't mind going off to search for Naminé myself. That is, if you're willing to help continue investigate the Organization in my place."

"Of course." Riku actually chuckled a little, which would have sounded nice with Riku's voice, but with Ansem's, it was just creepy.

Though, Mickey did ponder a little. "Although, if the Organization is truly more powerful than we thought, I'm not sure if I could handle it on my own... Well, I'll figure it out as I look around Twilight Town."

"Thanks Mickey." Riku said, before dropping a pouch into the King's hands. "And of course, you can hand this to Sora. Don't tell him about me though. I don't want him, or Kairi for that matter, to see me like this..."

Mickey didn't like the sound of that, but he reluctantly agreed. The Riku he knew underneath that shell of darkness had his own problems to deal with, problems that he would come to terms with in time. He smiled in spite of that.

"I understand." Mickey said. "And don't worry, I'll rescue Namine for you, I promise. She does mean a lot to you, after all. Actually, a lot, if I had to guess."

"Are you insinuating something?" Riku asked in a mixed tone of curiosity, amusement, and indignation.

"You tend to notice things at my age." Mickey gave a high-pitched laugh.

Riku decided not to dignify that with an answer.

Meanwhile

After getting their information from Hayner, Pence, and Olette, as well as saying good bye, Sora and his friends were off and running again, trying to find where the King was now.

"Gawrsh, maybe we should go up. Get a higher view." Goofy suggested.

"That sounds like a good idea." Sora agreed. "We could probably see the whole town from up there."

"Then what are we waiting for?" Donald quaked in his usual barely-readable dialect.

The trio had been looking around for a while, getting a feel for the layout. Sora had noticed that this was perhaps the longest he had gone without really fighting anything, quite the difference from when he was on his first adventure. Heartless were all over the place then, so maybe things had improved. Anything to give him a little piece of mind.

However, as they approached the top of the hill which revealed a clock tower and a train station, that all came to a grinding halt. Before long, strange white creatures featuring an unusual symbol appeared. Much like everything else so far, this came as odd to Sora, who was really beginning to wonder just why everything seemed familiar in a way. Well, in any case, these things seemed about as friendly as Heartless, so it was time to whip out the Kingdom Key once more. Thank goodness he didn't forget that at least.

The ensuing battle brought back a lot of memories: Sora doing much of the damage, Goofy providing support and defense, and Donald providing the magic and (occasional) healing. Though, despite that, the rust was showing, and it wasn't long before Sora and the others were feeling exhausted.

"I feel... really out of shape..." Sora sighed, falling back on his butt. Well, this didn't look too good.

However, coming in to save the day, a small black figure appeared, jumping back and forth rapidly and taking the white creatures down with ease. All three of them were left amazed at the skill of the little warrior, and once the dust had settled, a better look at the figure's Keyblade provided an easy answer.

"Your Majesty!" Donald and Goofy cried, pushing Sora down to get through to him.

Mickey immediately shushed them. "You gotta board the train and leave town! The train knows the way." He said this as he handed a pouch to Sora. "We'll talk later."

With that little addition, the King was off before anyone could get another word in, though Donald and Goofy were relieved to know that he was okay after all. The last time they had seen him was right after Ansem's defeat and he had been locked in the realm of darkness. Such good news meant to Sora that Riku had to be around too, furthering Sora's resolve to find him so they could head back to the Islands. Kairi was there after all. After Sora got a quick laugh out of Donald and Goofy about inquiring what they wanted to do, they were off.

What followed were the three of them being sent off by Hayner, Pence, and Olette. It just felt like something they wanted to do, though even they weren't sure. The oddities continued when they found out the pouch Mickey gave them looked the same as the one Olette had. Very strange indeed. In fact, after Sora got tickets for the train, he got this odd feeling, kind of like leaving home all over again. Course, in typical Donald and Goofy fashion, they figured he was over-thinking.

"Yeah...you're right," Sora smiled, though a part of him still wasn't too sure.

In any case, it was time to go.

Destiny Islands

"Wow....what a story," Kairi said in awe.

Namine just got done recounting most of what she could to Kairi as the two sat together on the beach. Vexen left them to look at some things on his own, and he really didn't need to be around for the "girl talk". Granted, Namine couldn't really explain every little detail to Kairi. They were a little pressed for time after all, so she made sure to nail the basics.

"So basically....you're a part of me that came about when Sora set my heart free?" Kairi asked.

"In a nutshell, yes," nodded Namine. "That left both you and Sora incomplete. But now Sora is finally awake again. That's why you've been able to recall him now, right?"

Kairi admittedly had felt a lot better of late. Slowly, everything had been coming back to her. Knowing full well who the "mystery boy" was finally gave her a little relief. Of course, at the same time, there was some dread too. That just meant he was still out there somewhere, which meant he wasn't here with her.

"Well, if I'm being honest, this isn't the strangest thing I've heard in my life," Kairi giggled a little, getting a similar reaction from Namine. "But basically, Sora is alright now?"

"Yes, and Riku is too, kind of," Namine said, a little sad at the last part. "So now, we should do the same thing. We need to re-complete you, and then Vexen can help you with bringing me back without hurting you."
155341211111111.title: Continue

1553412111111111.content:
Kairi exhaled a breath. The last week had been an absolute whirlwind for her mind. She had gone from very little recollection to a lot and then some in such a short time. Then again, after the first bout of craziness the trio had gone through a year ago, what was a little more craziness?

"So...I'm guessing by that, you mean you trust him," Kairi said, a mix between a statement and a question. "Despite what he did?"

"I like to believe it when someone says they want to atone," Namine smiled. "And I'm sure you do too."

"That's true," Kairi admitted. "So....how exactly do we do this then?"

"For you, not much," Namine said, getting up. "I'll handle the hard stuff."

Kairi didn't need much to comply with her request. Namine made for a pretty convincing story, and the uncanny resemblance took care of any other concerns she had. From her story, the tale of a Nobody sounded pretty harsh, so the idea that she could give back what Kairi needed and then be able to live on as her own self sounded nice. With that, Kairi stood up, all to eager to take a step forward towards getting her friends back.

"All right, let's do it," Kairi said resolutely.

"I'm ready too," Namine said, outstretching her hand towards Kairi.

Kairi reached out and took Namine's hand in her own, awaiting whatever Namine was going to do. Namine closed her eyes, and it wasn't long before her body was encased in light, surprising Kairi a little. As Namine's body began to fade into the light, that very light began flowing in Kairi, filling her up rather quickly. It was a strange yet warm sensation, and it ended nearly as soon as it began. Before long, Kairi's hand was empty, leaving her by herself.

"Wow......" Kairi said, looking down at herself. She didn't look any different, and didn't really feel different either. And yet, the feeling of "something" being there felt nice to her.

"About time," Vexen said as he walked over. "I was beginning to wonder if you two were going to talk until tomorrow."

"Well excuse me for just now discovering I had an other half," Kairi said, staring at Vexen. "So, what now? We go to where you'll bring her back?"

"Precisely," Vexen said, opening up a corridor of darkness. "I've been getting everything ready for us to do so."

"I'll be okay going through that, right?" Kairi asked curiously, pointing at the dark corridor.

"You'll be fine. You're a Princess of Heart," Vexen shrugged, as if pointing the obvious. "An ordinary person would be in quite a bit of trouble if they did, but not you."

"Great...." Kairi trailed off, giving off one last look towards her home.

Guess now she was taking her leave of the islands. Hopefully, by the time she saw it again, it would be with her friends in tow. And so, she entered the corridor, Vexen following right behind and closing it.

Twilight Town Station

As Donald and Goofy were getting some last-minute supplies, Sora took the chance to ponder things a little. Really, everything about this town looked nice, yet there was something off that continued to gnaw at him. It hit him once again as Hayner struck up a conversation with him, wondering if they had met before. Sora was positive they didn't, to which Hayner agreed. Weirdest of all, Sora actually found himself shedding a tear at the prospect of saying good bye, which caught the Twilight Trio's attention. They asked if he was okay, to which Sora just gave his usual grin, telling himself to get it together.

"Right....see ya!" Sora smiled and waved, getting on to the train after Donald and Goofy already went on.

Eventually, the train left, sending them to who knows where. Even after it left though, Sora's thoughts trailed on what had just happened. He continued to look out the window, seeing all of Twilight Town below him. He looked into the munny pouch, pulling out a little blue orb inside. It was kind of pretty to look at.

"You know.....I'm sad," Sora said, not to anyone in particular though Donald and Goofy heard it.

"We'll be back," Donald replied, as if there wasn't a doubt about it.

"Yeah! We can see Hayner and those guys again," agreed Goofy with a little laugh.

Sora looked towards his friends, smiling once again. Yeah, they were right. They'd come back some day. Nothing stopping them from doing that. Sora hoped that would assure whatever nerves were racking him at the moment.

And at that, a bright light burst around the train, blocking all outside view, before showing the vastness of the space between worlds.

Mysterious Tower

Before long, the train rode into a new world, well kind of at this point, following it's set of tracks towards a small piece of land. Donald and Goofy got off first once it stopped, with Sora following last. He looked up, taking a good look at the tower in front of them. Guess this was where Mickey wanted them to go to. As he turned back though, the train disappeared into light.

"There goes our ride...." Sora said with a nervous chuckle.

Welp, guess they were stuck here for the time being. Then again, Mickey must have wanted them to come here for a reason. In any case, there was no way to go but forward, though one look at the tower showed something odd. Some big guy hogging the door as if trying to find a way through.

"What's goin' on?" Donald said with exasperation.

The figure laughed. "I sent some of my lackeys inside to see if the master of this here tower's as big and tough as they say. Word is, he's a real powerful sorcerer. Which would make him the perfect bodyguard for me. See, it don't matter how tough he is, once he's a Heartless, he'll do as I say!"

"A Heartless?" Sora cried out, all three of them getting battle ready.

Needless to say, whoever this guy is was pretty off his rocker. He continued to go on and on about Heartless, as if it was really that easy. Although, once he mentioned Maleficent, an evil witch they defeated a while ago, and talking about building an army for her across multiple worlds, the stakes went just that much higher. Of course, he just told them to scram afterwards, not even bothering to look back. Goofy replied by saying he should find something nicer to do.

"Says who?" the being finally turned around to look at them. "Wha....AHHH! It's you!"

"Pete!" cried Donald.

"What are you two nimrod's doin here!?" Pete asked back.

"What are YOU doing here?!" Donald quaked right back.

When Sora inquired just who he was, Goofy explained that this was Pete, a real troublemaker who had been at it for ages. He was supposedly banished to another dimension years ago, yet somehow escaped. The explanation had Pete laughing, explaining that Maleficent got him out and that soon all the worlds would belong to him soon. The reason: Maleficent would help him. That pretty much got the trio all laughing at him.

Apparently Pete was completely unaware of Maleficent's demise at the hands of Sora and friends, getting him really worked up while the others just laughed. Perhaps predictably, this ended up in another Heartless battle. Thankfully, battling these guys was much easier than dealing with the white enemies, so they were taken care of easily, much to Pete's chagrin. The big guy just pouted and threw a tantrum at the Heartless being unsuccessful.

Afterwards, Sora inquired as to just who this tower belonged to. Pete found it hilarious that he would be here not knowing that, but he explained it was old Yen Sid, granted he was pretty confident he was a Heartless by now. This took Donald by surprise, and he rushed to the door as fast as he could. Goofy explained to Sora that Yen Sid was Mickey's teacher, impressing Sora so he took off, eagerly wanting to see this teacher as well. All the white, this just left Pete all alone, stupefied at just being ignored again.

Sora, Donald, and Goofy entered the tower, beginning to scale it at their earliest chance. Of course, the trail was littered with Heartless, causing the trio to take them out as they went. At the very least, they helped shake the rust off of Sora, who was still getting the kinks out of his muscles. Still, it was quite a climb, as the Tower seemed bigger on the inside than on the outside. The stairs went up endlessly, with Heartless all over the place. Donald got frustrated rather quickly after seeing them all, though Goofy was just glad they were on the case. It concerned Sora though, who had hoped the worlds would be more at peace now.

Well, no other way than forward, and they got the sense that their destination was right on the other side of the nearest door. Time to go meet Master Yen Sid.

15534121111111111.content:
Donald and Goofy went through the door first with Sora following right behind. Right as he entered, he looked all around the decently-sized room. Looked pretty spacious, with lots of trinkets hung all around. Certainly kind of gave the impression of some older resident. Of course, Sora was so taken in by the room that he didn't even initially notice Donald and Goofy bowing. On the other side of a desk sat an elderly man, sporting a long beard and wearing blue robes topped off with a pointy blue hat with star symbols.

"Master Yen Sid! It's an honor!" quaked Donald. Sora just took one look between Donald and Yen Sid before smiling as usual.

"Hey there!" Sora waved casually, much to the chagrin of his teammates.

"Sora! Show some respect!" Donald quaked angrily.

Sora laughed sheepishly at the chastising, though Yen Sid apparently took no offense, calming Sora's companions down. In fact, he was more interested in the fact that he was meeting Sora for the very first time. He asked if that had the chance to talk to King Mickey yet, a fact confirmed by Goofy though they had little time to talk.

"He need say we'd talk later though," Sora added to the conversation. "It sounded pretty urgent."

"I see," Yen Sid nodded. "Well, as we can't assume when of if he'll do so, the task of instructing you three rests on my shoulders then. The journey you face is perilous, so you must be prepared."

"You mean......we have to do on another quest?" Sora questioned, not sounding too thrilled. "I was looking forward to finding my friend Riku, so we could go back to the islands."

"Yes. I know. However, everything in your journey, Sora, is connected," Yen Sid explained. "Whether you will return to your home in the islands.....Whether you will return alone or with your friend...And, whether or not the islands will still be there. And the key that connects them is you, Sora."

"I'm.....the key?" Sora questioned, before summoning his Keyblade out of habit.

"Chosen wielder of the Keyblade!" Yen Sid continued. "You are the key that will open the door to light."

Taking it as a pledge of what he must do, Sora nodded. Guess it was time to be the hero once again. It wasn't what he planned, but if it was necessary, then he'd gladly take it up again. Yen Sid took notice of the resolve of all three present, before presenting a book to Sora regarding some knowledge he might need.
