He implored Sora to study it before they continued, which kind of reminded Sora of school back home. Not exactly the thing he wanted to remember of all things back on the islands. Come to think of it, how in the world would he handle school once he returned? Heck, how long had he even been gone at this point?

Well, that was all thinking for another time. Yen Sid waited patiently while Sora looked over the book, while Donald and Goofy relaxed a little. Lucky them. Anyway, a lot of what was written in the book was pretty cryptic, not quite what Sora was capable of understanding. He took his time in any case, unaware of how much time he was spending.

"Oh boy...it's like test time all over again," Sora grumbled, before closing the book.

It was right then though, that Yen Sid's door opened again, much to everyone's surprise. For a second, Sora, Donald, and Goofy began to think Pete followed them into the tower, making all three summon their weapons.

"Woah fellas!" the little figure raised his hands in surrender. "The cloak isn't that scary, is it?"

That little laugh at the end, plus the big round ears as the figure put his hood down, completely gave away who the mystery arrival was. It was King Mickey once again.

"Your Majesty!" Donald and Goofy cried, putting their weapons away and bowing immediately. "It's great to see you again!"

"Ah gosh you guys," Mickey smiled, laughing again before he looked over to Sora and Yen Sid. "Nice to see you too Sora."

"It's nice to see you two...uh, Your...Majesty?" It was almost amusing how much trouble Sora had with simple titles. Well, in any case. "So, how are you?"

"I've been well, thanks," Mickey nodded before turning to his old master, giving a respectful bow. "I apologize for coming right back on short notice. I didn't think I'd be back so soon."

"It is no trouble, Mickey," Yen Sid said with no offense taken. "I presume something has come up in your search?"

"You could say that," Mickey nodded. "I've come back with matters of my own, but I'll let you guys finish what you needed to first. Don't mind me."

Mickey then walked off to the side, letting their conversation continue since Sora had about enough of that book. Mickey didn't want to steal Yen Sid's explanation after he had already agreed to do it in Mickey's place. He could wait until they were done before conducting his own business.

"So, back to the other thing," Sora started. "Why are Heartless still around? Didn't what we did last time put a stop to them?"

"Your previous endeavors indeed did prevent a large infusion of Heartless from the great darkness. Do not presume your efforts were in vain," Yen Sid explained. "However, Heartless are darkness made real, and darkness exists in every heart. They are fewer in number, but extremely difficult to eradicate completely. Even a single heart filled with darkness can call upon the Heartless."

That was dis-heartening, though it made sense. If Heartless were so easy to take care of, such a thing probably would have been done ages ago. Goofy came up with the obvious solution: that if everyone's heart was filled with light, then there'd be no more Heartless. An idealistic goal to be sure. Sora certainly liked it, and Mickey gave a little laugh at the fun thought. Yen Sid didn't even object to it. Still, in any case, they had more concerning matters to attend to.

"Now it is time to speak of the enemies you will encounter," Yen Sid continued, making Mickey's ears perk up. This was especially important.

Yen Sid continued with reviewing the basics of how the Heartless operated: beings that came into existence due to a corrupted heart. Heartless were always around, seeking for more hearts to add to their ranks. It made it all the more important to keep your guard up around such beings. Afterwards, using his magic once more, Yen Sid conjured up another being next to the imaginary Heartless, a familiar silvery being that caught Sora's attention. It was the same beings they fought earlier. Mickey's eyes fixed themselves on the being, a reminder of what he was investigating.

"At times, if someone with a strong heart and will, be they evil or good, becomes a Heartless," Yen Sid continued. "The empty shell they leave behind begins to act with a will of its own. An empty vessel whose heart has been taken away....A spirit that goes on even as its bodies fade from existence, for you see--Nobodies do not truly exist at all."

"Nobodies..." Sora mumbled, hearing the name of these new enemies for the first time.

Honestly, hearing that caused a strange feeling in his chest, almost as if the words struck a chord with him somehow.

"Nobodies may seem to have feelings, but this is a ruse--they only pretend to have hearts," Yen Sid continued. "You must not be deceived!"

"They don't.....exist?" Sora mumbled again.

Mickey closed his eyes a little. Honestly it was a little harsher than he would have put it. Truthfully, it wasn't entirely certain if that was the case. Surely, that's how typical belief on Nobodies were, but it wasn't like they were experts on the subject. Nobodies had only recently truly begun to make an impact on the worlds. Mickey still wanted to investigate himself the true nature of them, as well as the Organization. Besides, there was Namine....

Okay, now Sora was sure something was going on inside him. He passed it off as just a funny feeling before, but now it was like there was a little pressure inside him, like something building up....

"What is this feeling?" Sora asked himself.

Station of Serenity

Roxas wasn't sure how long he had been here. Time seems to get pretty hazy down here. Still, at least he got a taste of what was going on outside in regards to Sora. Having to leave Heyner, Pence, and Olette so suddenly got a reaction from him, hence why it was shown through Sora. Roxas still wasn't keen on giving up what him himself though, which was probably why he was just sitting by his lonesome in what he assumed was Sora's heart.

Admittedly though, he was curious to see where this was going, seeing some old Keyblade Master and all. He didn't pay much attention to all the little things like Pete. Not like that stuff really mattered to him. No, he wanted to hear that this upcoming conversation was going to entail. For the most part, it was stuff about Heartless that he already knew, making him think he wasn't going to get much out of this.

Until the Nobody talk happened.

Nobodies do not truly exist at all.

"What?" Roxas spoke, for perhaps the first time since Sora woke up. "How can he say that? Is he trying to say the last year I spent alive was nothing?"

Nobodies may seem to have feelings, but this is a ruse--they only pretend to have hearts.

At that, Roxas stood up from where he was sitting. Excuse me? What in the world did that old bag know? He trying to say everything Roxas felt was nothing? Having to leave behind his friend Axel? His desire to take down the Organization which lead to his capture? Having to say good bye to Hayner, Pence, and Olette who turned out to be digital when he was there?

And....this bizarre feeling he kept getting... and the briefest of images.....of another time he shed tears....holding a hand in his own....

A Nobody does not have the right to know, nor does it have the right to be

All at once, something inside Roxas exploded.
15534121111111111.title: Continue

155341211111111111.content:
*Twilight Town Mansion*

In a secluded space, expertly hidden by Namine, two replica bodies were laying side by side, having been hooked up to Sora since Vexen brought them.to Namine. One of them had started to glow from when Namine hooked them up, obviously reacting to Xion, while Roxas's replica did little until his return to Sora. However, by now, his was glowing brightly. A whirlwind of emotions was stirring within him, memories coming forth of everything he had gone through over the past year.

Organization XIII, Riku, that red man, and now this supposed old Keyblade Master. Each of them in some way acted like they had something to say about how he should live, like he was less important as his own person. It infuriated him. It always had to be about Sora. Why him? What was it apparently all about him?

"AHHHHHHHHH!" Roxas gave one big cry from within Sora's heart, light encapsulating him.

At the same time, light completely surrounded the replica body, and by the time the light faded, it was gone.

Mysterious Tower

"Urgh!" Sora grunted, feeling the pressure growing in his chest.

"Sora, are you okay?" Mickey asked, coming over to check him over. "Are you in pain?"

"I....I don't think so..." Sora said. "It's just....it's like something's building in my chest...."

At that, a spark of light appeared over Sora's chest, appearing for a brief while though stunning every person in the room. Even Yen Sid seemed affected, though the only indication of this was some raising of his eyebrows. It was like a brief spark of light was leaving Sora for some reason, though no one could explain why. After a little bit, the light faded from Sora's body, leaving him a little out of breath but nothing too bad. It only caused him to stagger a little before he was upright again.

"What was.....?" Donald began to say.

"...that?" Goofy finished.

Before anyone could utter another word though, there was another flash of light, although this one was more....aggressive was the word? It came from the ceiling, arriving right on top of Yen Sid's desk. Not sure what was going on, all 4 warriors drew their weapons just in case, as the light began to form into a humanoid shape. As it was doing so, the figure's right hand reached out, a distinctive Keyblade forming that happened to match Sora's own.

"Huh?" Sora asked. The only time anyone else held Kingdom Key was when Riku took the Keyblade from him at Hollow Bastion. Sora looked to his hands, confirming he still had his Keyblade. So why did this person have it?

"You...." the figure spoke, before the light began to die down and everyone could see the emergence of a black coat. While it held no significance to Sora, Donald, or Goofy, Mickey on the other hand was more alarmed.

"What? The Organization?!" he cried out, gripping Kingdom Key D harder. How did they get here? And how did they have another Keyblade wielder? He assumed Riku would have handled all that given Sora was alive and well.

"What...are you talking about?" Sora asked, clearly confused as to what was going on.

The black-cloaked figure either didn't hear them or just didn't care. What was evident though was that whoever it was was angry, very much so in fact. The hand holding Kingdom Key trembled, and staggering breathing could be heard. Yen Sid didn't seem to move one bit despite the person arriving almost literally right in front of him.

"Who are you talk, old man?" the figure spat. "You saying I'm just nothing? That I have no emotions? Who are you to say such a thing?"

Everyone remained on guard, but were all confused and a little off-put by just how angry the figure sounded. It even sounded a little choked up, like it was having trouble getting words out at times.

"You know.....I'm getting kind of tired of people always thinking they know better than I do how I should live," the figure continued after a while. "For the first year of my life, people made use of me for my power. Only one person ever actually showed me respect like I was a person. And then Riku showed up, doing everything to make sure I returned to Sora. That was all he ever talked about. All about Sora. Even that guy in red had me trapped in his own personal simulation to keep me around until I had to go back. He too even denied me any right to exist."

Sora's eyes widened at the words, letting down his Keyblade a little. How was this guy related to him? And he knew Riku? He eagerly wanted to ask if he knew more, but something told him the guy wasn't done talking. Mickey was also attentive to what the figure was saying, feeling an odd mix of confusion and sadness. Beneath the hood, the figure was gritting his teeth, even turning around to face the others. They couldn't see the top half of his face, but Sora noticed tears beginning to come down.

The figure wasn't sure if the others even knew what the heck he was talking about, but he didn't care at this point. He was going to say his piece whether or not they had a clue. Maybe it was nice for others to be the clueless ones for once.

"Not only that, but I sometimes get a strange feeling in my chest of something else that's missing. Something else that I think was taken from me, and I bet that has all to deal with you too," the figure pointed Kingdom Key at Sora, making him raise his own slightly. "Of all things, why is it always about you? Being your Nobody has done nothing for me!"

At that, the figure took down his hood, revealing himself to all in the room. At the same time, he held out Kingdom Key, before another key formed in his other hand, both blades transforming into distinctive forms that Sora knew very well. He gasped at the sight of Oathkeeper and Oblivion in the mystery figure's hands. Furthermore, the sight of the guy's face brought a look of shock to Mickey's face. It was that of someone dear to him.

"Ven?!" he cried out. "H-How are you here?!"

If Roxas was capable of getting any angrier, he just did. Who the heck was Ven? He was getting tired of names by now.

"Shut up!" he cried out, wielding Oathkeeper as to prove a point. ""First Sora, now this Ven... My name is Roxas! Get it memorized!"

Needless to say, Mickey was stunned silent, while Sora's brain was just trying to comprehend everything he was being told. Donald and Goofy were completely lost by now. Yen Sid himself seemed to be deep in contemplation, probably processing the information better than anyone else was.

There was a little bit of awkward silence, as Roxas had stopped his ranting, coming down from Yen Sid's desk. He wasn't sure who he was angrier at at the moment: Yen Sid for being another person who denied his existence, or Sora for being the one he had to give everything for in the first place. Granted, he didn't particularly care which one, though he happened to be facing Sora at the moment, who was looking at the ground.

"So....you're saying you're my Nobody?" Sora asked a little tentatively. "But....how can you be when.......Oh."

"Riku told me you turned yourself into a Heartless to save Kairi earlier," Mickey said, putting aside his own confusion as to why Roxas resembled his old friend.

"That's right.....guess that makes sense," Sora said, lowering Kingdom Key again.

At this, Roxas glared at Sora again, bringing his attention back to him.

"So nice that you're finally up to speed," Roxas spat at him. "Which still doesn't change anything. I'd like to know what makes you so special! I had to give up everything just so you could wake up! So tell me that!"

At that, Roxas kicked his foot off the ground, rushing right towards Sora at blinding speeds. Immediately, Mickey, Donald, and Goofy began rushing to get in front of Sora, weapons at the ready. Taking a second for it all to sink in however, Sora put his hands out.

"Stay back everyone!" Sora cried out. "Don't do anything!"

"Sora, what are you saying?!" Donald quaked.

"He's coming right for ya!" Goofy cried as well.

"Sora!" yelled Mickey.

Their hesitation at Sora's words made it all too easy for Roxas to approach Sora. Time seemed to slow down, as Roxas's blades got closer to Sora. Oblivion was raised high, ready to be the first one to strike Sora. Mickey reached out, calling Sora's name again while Donald and Goofy began to get closer. What was just a second felt like an eternity to all five involved.

And when time seemed to go back to normal, Oblivion lingered right above Sora's head, trembling as if eager to come down on him at any second. However, what really stood out was Roxas's face, who was twisted with confusion.

"What in the world are you not raising your Keyblade?" Roxas asked, surprisingly calmer than his face indicated.

"You said you went through a lot of trouble because of me, right?" Sora asked, sadness evident in his voice. For someone he only just realized existed in the first place, something told him that everything Roxas said was true. "Then if that's the case, take it out on me. Don't get my friends involved."

At that, Sora even tossed Kingdom Key over to the side, the blade just sitting there instead of being called back to its owner. This just confused Roxas even more. Why was he doing this? Why was he not defending himself? He should have every reason to fight back, right? To prove he was better.

"Why? Why are you acting like this?" Roxas said through clinched teeth. "You don't know me all that well. For all you know, everything you've been told about Nobodies could be true, so why through your Keyblade aside like that?"

Even Roxas was amazed that he sounded as calm as he did, despite the lingering tension all throughout his body at wanting to continue what he started.
155341211111111111.title: Continue

1553412111111111111.content:
"Maybe I don't you too well personally..." Sora started while looking down a little bit. "But...now that I think about it, those feelings I must have had when I got to Twilight Town must have been your feelings. You...must have really enjoyed the life you had before I came around..."

Roxas's teeth gritted again, not moving from his spot and still lingering Oblivion above Sora. He wasn't sure what to make of Sora's words. Was he trying to be consoling to someone he just now realized existed? How could he? No one had to be that accepting of something so soon.

"You can't be serious. How can you believe all that?" Roxas spat.

"I can because that shows how different you and I are," Sora looked back, looking more determined in his expression. "You have your own feelings and I have mine. If you feel like you need to take out your frustration and sadness, then do so on me if it'll make you feel better."

Roxas couldn't believe his ears. This was ridiculous. How could someone even think of the idea of letting them be vented on like this? Was Sora really that stupid? Or just naive to the point of stupid? It almost made Roxas want to bring the blade down right then, and yet his hand continued to stall. Why? Why couldn't he do anything with all of this pent-up emotion?

It was then that images of Sora began to flash through Roxas's mind. Honestly, it was stuff that had happened before, but he didn't like paying any mind to them. Yet, this time, it was like everything was passing by his eyes like watching a movie. How Sora acted so selflessly with just about every person he interacted with, never once wishing ill upon them. However, what stood out the most was the moments within Hollow Bastion. That, when faced with the fact that Kairi's heart was inside his own, he was freely willing to condemn himself to being a Heartless just so she got to live again. All that at the cost of his own life, the very event that birthed Roxas in the first place. In a sense, it felt ironic.

Roxas began to tremble even more, soft whimpering beginning to utter from his mouth. Darn it....why did this guy have to be so darn selfless? Why did he have to make it so hard to actually stay angry at him? Roxas's frustration continued to grow, until even he could tell where were drops of water going down his face. Sora even seemed to smile sadly.

"You see that? You need a heart to cry," Sora said simply.

All eyes were on Roxas as he trembled, unable to contain what was going on inside of him. He slowly began bringing Oblivion down, his whimpers beginning to turn into sobs. Out of the blue, Roxas let out another loud cry, slamming Oblivion down to the ground beside Sora, actually creating a rather sizable dent in the floor. Heck, any harder and he might have broken a hole completely through it. He feel to his knees right afterwards, feeling a rising mix of frustration and anguish.

"Gawrsh....sounds like he had it rough...." Goofy said sadly.

"That's not right....." Donald seemed to agree with him.

Right after that, Sora began to move towards Roxas, much to everyone's curiosity. He knelled down beside Roxas, before actually enveloping him in a hug.

"W-What are you doing?!" Roxas spoke out in surprise.

"Well, considering your body came from me, that kind of makes us brothers, right?" Sora asked, his trademark grin returning. "Or close enough at least, right?"

As if Roxas could get any more flabbergasted at what he was seeing. If not for his memories of Sora confirming this was how he really was, he would be sure he was getting pranked or something. At that, Roxas actually began to laugh a little. No one could really guess what was fueling it. Whether he found this funny, or was so off-put by everything that he couldn't help but laugh.

"That guy in red was right about you," Roxas said, finally wiping his tears away. "You really are too nice for your own good."

"That's Sora for you," laughed Donald.

"And we wouldn't have him any other way," Goofy laughed as well.

"Hey, come on!" Sora pouted indignantly at the teasing, before joining his buddies in laughter.

Mickey let loose a breath he didn't even know he was holding in, feeling relieved that somehow the tension was lightening up. He walked over to Yen Sid while the others were still having their moment. Yen Sid hadn't spoken a word, merely taking in everything he was seeing.

"Seems like we've had quite the revelation today," smiled Mickey.

"Indeed," nodded Yen Sid. "And I believe I'm beginning to see what is the source of young Roxas's emotions. You mentioned your old friend, correct?"

"Right," said Mickey. "Ven vanished after they fought Xehanort. To think his image would appear in Roxas....it's got to be connected."

"I agree," Yen Sid nodded again. "Truly, when it comes to Sora, everything is indeed connected."

The two just watched as Sora, Donald, and Goofy had a little bit of fun with Roxas, who was clearly still coming to grips with everything that just happened. He wasn't even sure if he could fully believe it, yet here he was, his own original treating him as his own person. This feeling felt so familiar, the feeling of being surrounded by friends...
1553412111111111111.title: Continue

15534121111111111111.content:
The mood had considerably lightened since Roxas's initial appearance, and a little time was allowed for things to fully return to normal before proceeding with any other important business. Sora certainly had some questions of his own that he was eager to ask Roxas.

"So how can you do that?!" asked Sora with excitement.

"Do what?" Roxas asked in confusion.

"Use two Keyblades," Sora clarified, gesturing to the two blades Roxas held. "I didn't know that was even possible."

Looking at Sora's gesture, Roxas had totally forgotten that he was still holding his Keyblades, finally dispelling them since they weren't needed. Still, Sora's question actually puzzled him for a bit...

"Um....that's a good question actually...." Roxas pondered. "From what I remember, I only used one Keyblade before, but I could use two by the time I was captured."

"You mean you don't know?" quaked Donald.

"No. It feels like....my memory's really off," Roxas said with one hand to his head. "There's this one big confusing spot between when I left the Organization and when I came back and got captured. Before, I had one Keyblade, and then I had two. It...doesn't make much sense I guess..."

"Huh....weird," Sora pondered as well.

At that point, Mickey took a moment to intervene.

"Roxas, I apologize for what I called you earlier," Mickey said, lowering his head a little before raising it again. "It's just that you have an incredible resemblance to an old friend of mine who was also a Keyblade wielder."

Roxas seemed perplexed yet curious at that. Sora's mouth went open at it.

"Wait, you know other Keyblade wielders?" he asked.

"Of course, Sora. Keyblade wielders aren't a new thing," Mickey chuckled a little. "They've been around for years. Why, it wasn't that long ago that there used to be a place where many were trained in the arts of the Keyblade. Sadly, it's not around anymore. In any case, I knew one such boy. His name was Ventus, Ven for short. And Roxas here could easily be his twin."

"That's...weird. I'm pretty sure he doesn't sound familiar," said Roxas, giving it a little thought in case he came across such a person in his travels to other worlds. "Nope, doesn't ring a bell."

"Hmm, very curious," pondered Yen Sid. "Yet, I doubt this is a coincidence. Mickey, you know what became of Ven, correct?"

"Of course. How could I forget?" Mickey sighed. "When we brought him here, his heart had already left his body."

"Wait, your friend lost his heart?" Sora piped in.

"Yes. It's a little complicated to give you the whole story, but in short his heart was nearly taken over, and my other friend and I had to stop him," said Mickey. "She left to take his body to a safe place, and that was the last I saw of either of them."

What a pretty sad story. Sora, Donald, and Goofy also had a despondent look on their faces at the idea of losing a friend. For Roxas, it felt like those strange feeling he had been experiencing for a while now were coming back. There was even a tear forming on the corner of his eye, though it didn't fall. Somehow, the idea of losing a friend....felt familiar to him somehow. For a second, Roxas wondered about Axel, but he had a feeling that wasn't the case.

"So, what does that mean?" asked Donald.

"I wonder.....could Ven's heart be related to Sora?" said Yen Sid. "That in turn would explain why his Nobody would resemble Ven instead of Sora himself."

This all sounded familiar to Sora as well, though for a different reason he was pondering about.

"Wait....is it like what happened with Kairi?" he asked, putting a hand to his chest. "If Ven's heart is missing....then does that mean it's inside me as well?"

"Well, it's possible I guess," Mickey said. "You wouldn't happen to remember anything of note would you?"

"Hmm......well....." Sora pondered for a minute, before something came to mind. "Well, I'm not sure if it's related, but...there's something that happened when I was a kid. Like....I think I had this dream where I got a really warm sensation. Actually, it wasn't too long after Riku and I met this blue-haired woman on the beaches."

"You met Aqua?!" Mickey cried out. "She was my other friend! She and I were the ones who saved Ven back then."

"Am I the only one who's head is going in circles now?" Roxas asked, like a student asking a question in class. Donald and Goofy shook their heads.

"Nope. I'm confused," sighed Donald.

"I think my head hurts," groaned Goofy.

This seemed to be turning into quite the revelation. Roxas's own appearance here bringing to light matters that Mickey had spent much time on trying to figure out himself. Honestly, he was feeling pretty happy about it. In his investigation of the Nobodies, he had stumbled upon potential information regarding his old friends. To say the King was feeling pretty happy would be an understatement.

"So...does this Ven really is inside me too?" Sora asked. "Because..."

At that, Donald and Goofy immediately went up to Sora, looking quite flustered.

"Don't even think about stabbing yourself again!" Donald quaked.

"Yeah, I don't ta see you as a Heartless again," Goofy agreed.

Sora ended up smiling sheepishly, quickly giving an apology. No further explanation was needed on it. Roxas actually knew it from seeing Sora's memories, and Mickey was filled in on pretty much everything that happened a year ago.

"Hmm, curious revelations we've stumbled upon," said Yen Sid. "That may well explain Roxas's special circumstances."

"Still though....." Roxas said, looking back at Yen Sid. The old master seemed to read his mind.

"If I offended you earlier, I apologize. Such was not my intention," Yen Sid said, closing his eyes a little. "If I may clarify though, I do believe that the majority of Nobodies are very much like this. Your situation is very unique. Not only being the Nobody of a Keyblade wielder, but also possibly being influenced by another heart."

Roxas heard what the master said, and it did make sense. His anger from earlier had subsided, as it wasn't worth really holding on to it anymore.

"If I may continue on a little more, Sora does need to learn more about Nobodies," Yen Sid explained. "I presume you know what these are, Roxas?"

Yen Sid then conjured up another illusion, which took the shape of one of those silver creatures from before. Of course, Roxas knew what they were.

"Yeah, those are Dusks," Roxas said, getting Sora's attention. "They're kind of like basic soldiers. The Organization would use them for all sorts of tasks. Maybe grunts are a better word."

"Correct, they are the most basic form of Nobody," Yen Sid explained. "However, much like the Heartless, there are those with larger forms and far more deadlier powers."

"That true?" Sora asked Roxas.

"Yep. The Dusks don't really compare to some of the others I've seen," Roxas said. "Many in the Organization can control special Nobodies, and they're in a class of their own. I've never had to fight them myself, so I can't say much about their abilities."

"Hmm...." Sora, Donald, and Goofy all nodded, before Sora opened his mouth. "You've mentioned an "Organization" quite a few times. Who are they?"

"If I may?" Yen Sid seemed to ask in Roxas's direction.

"Go ahead," Roxas crossed his arms. Guess the Organization was next on the list.

Castle Oblivion

A corridor of darkness appeared within the pure white castle, allowing Vexen and Kairi to walk out. She shivered a little at though.

"Wow it was cold going through that," she rubbed her arms. "Those corridors always like that?"

"Hardly anything of note to those like us," Vexen chuckled a little. "In any case, welcome princess to Castle Oblivion. A rather fitting name so I'd advise not getting lost."

Kairi stood in awe of the place. All she could see was one room, but she somehow got this sense that the place was absolutely huge. True, she probably would get lost in such a place without a guide.

"This place really important?" she asked.

"Why yes it is," Vexen said casually. "In fact, you could say it was the beginning of why you had trouble remembering Sora for so long. It's where he got all his own memories scrambled."

Honestly, if not for the fact that Namine already included in her little story that Vexen played a role in how bad things got but he wanted to atone for them, Kairi would probably feel more scared at this. Yet, Namine believed in him, and she supposed she got that feeling as well. In any case though, Vexen directed her vision over to a seat among what seemed like a lot of lab equipment. There was a white body there, emitting a soft glow.

"Is that....?" Kairi asked.

"Yes, Namine's replica," Vexen explained. "Right now it's connected to bring her out of you. Like with the others, a strong reaction would be needed for her to come back. As for how, well that's up to you or Sora. Whichever one of you has a strong reaction to her."

"Wouldn't that be me though?" Kairi tilted her head. "She's my Nobody, right?"

"True, but you only just now learned of her. Your connection may not be too strong," Vexen explained. "Sora on the other hand has extensive experience with her, as does his Nobody to an extent. They were born at the same time after all after Sora released your heart as well as his own. As long as there's a reaction somewhere, Namine should come back."

Kairi nodded at Vexen's words. It was kind of confusing, but she hoped it would resolve itself soon enough. She smiled a little though. She had to think Sora was probably doing something that would solve things. That's how he was after all.
15534121111111111111.title: Continue

155341211111111111111.content:
Mysterious Tower

Yen Sid once again conjured up new images, bringing up 3 mysterious hooded figures. Roxas and Mickey hummed a bit at the sight, knowing more about this than others present, while Sora, Donald, and Goofy's curiosity was evident.

"Organization XIII is comprised of many powerful Nobodies. It commands the lesser Nobodies, as Roxas alluded to," said Yen Sid. "While Heartless act on instinct, Nobodies act in a higher manner. They can act, think, and it appears they're working towards a goal. Roxas, shall I presume you know as to their goal?"

"Well, for most of them anyway," Roxas said, crossing his arms. "Everyone in the Organization wants to become whole again, so we were collecting hearts for Kingdom Hearts. Take a guess as to what my role was since I have a Keyblade."

Sora piped up at that remark.

"Kingdom Hearts?" he asked. "But isn't that....?"

"Not the same one you saw before," Roxas clarified, remembering Sora's memories of that. "It was one the Organization was putting together. I was the one tasked with collecting most of the hearts. Truthfully speaking, for a long time, I just did whatever they asked. I don't think I remembered much of anything for a long time."

"That probably had to do with the fact that Sora was revived by Kairi," Mickey gave his thoughts.

Both Sora and Roxas nodded at that, as it sounded sensible enough. That brought Sora to another thought though.

"So...you know a lot about the Organization members, right?" asked Sora.

"Most of them at least," Roxas said. "Those that went to Castle Oblivion, I never got too close to except for Axel. The others, I know enough about them."

"Could you tell us more?" Sora asked, getting nods from Donald, Goofy, and Mickey.

"If I may Roxas," Yen Sid spoke up. "I can show more of the Organization's members through your memories if you wish."

"Sure, I suppose," Roxas shrugged.

After a second, Yen Sid cast another spell, and the 3 hooded figures that were in front of them began to display more distinct features. In particular, their faces could be shown. Roxas's face grew more stern at the sight, showing a man with an eyepatch, one with blue hair, and another with striking silver hair: Xigbar, Saix, and Xemnas.

"Those guys are pretty much the top 3 in the Organization," Roxas said. "Xigbar is the one with eyepatch, and he's basically the No.2, both in title and function, answers directly to Xemnas. Saix is the blue-haired one, and he was always commanding the rest of us for our missions. I even briefly fought him, though I don't think he went all-out."

"And....Xemnas?" Sora asked, after nodding about the others. Looking at the silver-haired man was giving him chills, reminding him of a certain other villain.

"He's the leader, the one who got everyone together under the goal of getting our hearts back," Roxas said. "Though, truth be told, I was trying to disrupt what he was doing."

"How come?" asked Donald.

"I....can't explain," Roxas said, a hand to his head. "It all happens at the same time I got my second Keyblade. I charged the Organization's world in hopes of getting to Xemnas and setting Kingdom Hearts free. Why....I can't say..."

"Huh...." Sora nodded before looking back at the projections. "So, what do you think Roxas? Do they have emotions like you?"

"Well, everyone I know had their own quirks," Roxas said with a finger to his chin. "Demyx always liked to goof around. Luxord likes his cards, and so on like that. Saix...well I'd say he fits Yen Sid's definition. He really does come across as emotionless. Xemnas as well."

"Guess everyone is unique in their own way," Goofy said with his usual grin, always seeing the silver lining of things.

"I suppose so," Roxas smiled a little, before something else came to mind. "Oh, Namine's also someone who had emotions. She wasn't in the Organization though."

"Namine?" Sora asked, before remembering Jiminy's journal. "Wait....that name was in Jiminy's journal. What's that about?"

"I can probably tell you the gist of it," Mickey came up. "Riku and I went into Castle Oblivion around the same time you did. That's where you went after fighting Ansem. We both fought against members of the Organization there."

"Really?" Sora asked.

"Right, and those were the ones I don't know as well," Roxas said. "And Namine was involved as well, though I didn't know that before joining you."

"Truth be told, Namine is also a special Nobody. She's Kairi's actually," explained Mickey, much to Sora's surprise. "Surprised? She was born the same time as Roxas. Remember? You released both her heart and yours, and both came into existence because of that. Riku actually helped to explain most of what was going on."

"So...Namine is someone I know?" Sora asked.

"More or less. The Organization used her to mess with your memories. That's why you were kept in hiding for so long," said Mickey. "She was really distraught about doing so of course, so she wanted to make it up to you by fixing your memories. You wanted to thank her for it."

Sora pondered on those words for a second, before a surge began to go through his head. It wasn't quite like what happened with Roxas, but it was close. Brief images of a blonde-haired girl, with a face identical to Kairi's, went through his head thanks to Mickey's words. Granted, not too much came aside from that, but Sora did feel a familiar warmth.

"I see....I think you're right," Sora smiled once the sensation passed. "So, that means we should make sure to thank her for that, and then we can be friends for real."

"How does he do it?" Roxas shrugged and sighed.

Everyone was amused by that, though nobody noticed the sensation that passed away from Sora, his determination and gratitude beginning to make their way towards a certain someone.

Castle Oblivion

"Huh?" Kairi said suddenly.

A small light was beginning to form in her chest, making her look down. She wasn't sure what was going on, though the sensation was really warm. Actually, it was kind of familiar too, the feeling only one person would ever convey to her, making her smile at the thought.

"Sora...." she said. "You did something, didn't you?"

Her rhetorical question going unanswered, yet didn't require one, the light began to glow brighter, and Vexen finally caught sight of it after looking up from his equipment. The replica body sitting nearby was beginning to glow even more than it did before. Vexen grinned at the sight.

"Ah, finally," he chuckled.

As if Sora's determination and Kairi's will were coming together, the light from her went towards the replica body, making it glow even more so until it began to change shape beneath the light. Kairi could barely make out feminine features forming on the replica body, with blonde hair beginning to shine through and the body being covered by a white dress. Before long, Kairi's body stopped glowing, making her take in a breath from the sensation. Once that happened, the light stopped on the replica body, revealing Namine's form in its entirety.

"Umm.....huh...." Namine slowly began opening her eyes, as if waking up from a long nap. "Where.....wait.....?"

"Welcome to Castle Oblivion, though I'm sure you could guess that already," Vexen chuckled.

"What? I...." Namine sputtered a little, before her head began to get itself on straight. "You...you hid my replica here?"

"Of course. Who else in the Organization would suspect it here without me around?" Vexen said as a matter of fact. "It's a smart hiding place if I do say so myself."

"In any case, welcome back," Kairi smiled, walking over to Namine and offering her a hand. "Nice to see you as your own self."

"Heh....same here," Namine smiled, taking her hand.

It was actually real. She could actually live apart with Kairi while not having to take away from her. It was kind of funny in the sense that she didn't feel any different, despite there being a world of difference.

But, it didn't really matter. She was real now, and hopefully Roxas and Xion would get that too.

Mysterious Tower

"But yeah...." Roxas continued once their brief talk of Namine calmed down. "She and Axel. They both have helped many others like Sora and myself. They wouldn't do that without emotions."

"You said Axel was your friend, right?" Mickey asked before chuckling a little. "Perhaps you had a positive influence on him."

Some thoughts of Axel having to teach Roxas just about anything and everything went through Roxas's head, making him smile a little. He always do whatever it took to help, even though he often complained. Though, for a brief moment, as he went through memories of Axel explaining various things on the Clock Tower, he could give this brief feeling of someone else leaning up against his left side. A flash of black clothes and black hair.

"I'm not sure," Roxas smirked a little. "He was the one who often had to babysit me while I had no memories or emotions to go on. My other friend too. He did a lot for both her and me."
155341211111111111111.title: Continue

1553412111111111111111.content:
That caught most of them off guard. This was the first time Roxas mentioned having any other friends outside of Axel. And a girl too? Most interesting.

"Oh, a girl?" asked Donald, though you could hear a glimmer of chuckling in the duck's mouth. "And who was that?"

Roxas stiffened a bit at Donald's words. "Wait....what? What did I say?" he asked, not sounding sure at all with a hand to his head.

"Why are you asking us?! You just said you had another friend!" Donald said, getting a little louder.

"Um....did I.....?" Roxas wasn't sure if that was a question or statement. And if it was a question, to whom he was asking.

Everyone else eyed Roxas a little, kind of making the Nobody feel a little uncomfortable as if being scrutinized. Granted, he could understand why. Roxas didn't like the idea that there might remain other things about himself that he was unaware of. That was bad enough with what he had gone through already. Though, after a minute of silence, Goofy spoke up.

"Wait, I got it!" he said happily. "Maybe your memories got altered too! Just like Sora!"

"Oh, that's right?" Sora grinned, even pointing at Goofy. "So if my memories got all messed up, then maybe yours did too. After all, weren't you saying something about not remembering a bunch when you got your second Keyblade?"

Roxas heard all those words, and right then his head began to hurt a little. What was going on? Why was there such a gap in his memory between leaving the Organization and then returning with a vengeance to stop Xemnas? Why were there thoughts of a second friend that would come and go as quickly as they came? It was like something fighting to resurface after being submerged in water, although in this case, the effort of resurfacing was causing him pain. This was not unlike how he felt back at the mansion when he got his memories of the Organization, although this somehow felt worse.

Not worse in a pain sense. That was the same. The difference was that these sensations carried a sense of....dread maybe? Like, he was especially emotionally tied to these for reasons he couldn't understand. It was more than just memories. It was almost like he lost a part of himself, figuratively and literally somehow.

"Roxas!" Sora cried out, coming over to help him, before he felt a little sensation in his chest as well. "Ugh....me too?"

"What's going on now?!" Donald cried out, kind of getting tired of seeing his friend in distress again.

"I don't know. There's another feeling in my chest...." Sora said, looking over at Roxas, who had both hands on his head now. "But I think it's hurting him more!"

"Ahhhhhhhhh!" Roxas cried out.

Darn it, come on! What's going on?! WHO ARE YOU?!

Somewhere in the darkness

Suffice to say, Xion actually felt kind of happy a while ago. For the briefest of moments, she could feel Roxas's presence inside of Sora, meaning that Sora had to be complete at long last. The sensation that Sora was finally back to normal and she and Roxas were both where they belonged made her happy, though she wished she could at least see Roxas. Her situation hadn't changed one bit, just lingering around wherever she was. Still, guess as long as everything was right, she was content.

Still....what she wouldn't give to actually see him again....she still stood by the fact that she did what she needed to, yet it was hard to deny the loneliness she now felt even being a part of Sora. How long had it even been by this time?

Well, at some point though, Xion finally got another moment of lucidity. However, with it came something else. In-between the last time she finally got a feeling for something, the sensation she got from Roxas was gone.

"Roxas?.....Are you there?....." she mouthed.

She tried feeling for the same warm sensation she got when she first learned that he was here, and yet there was none. Trying to keep herself "above water" for as much as possible, she kept on trying to feel for him. Yet, for as long as she did, there seemed to be no trace of him. The bits of him that belonged to Sora were still here....but the parts that were undeniably Roxas were gone.

"Roxas? Roxas?!" Xion began raising her voice. "Where are you?!"

Why? Why he not here? Even if he returned everything he needed to give to Sora, memories and feelings that were his own should remain, just like her at the least. The feeling that there was nothing at all began to make her panic, all the more so at the familiar feeling of being pulled under again.

"No! Not yet!" Xion cried out, flailing her arms about like someone trying to keep from drowning. "I need to find Roxas! He can't be gone!"

Honestly, part of her was fearing the worst, that Roxas truly gone now. As in completely gone, without a trace of what made him special or the memories they shared like hers. She fought hard against the darkness threatening to take her back under, though it felt almost futile. Whatever this place was was stronger than her.

"No....please no...." Xion struggled, unknowingly beginning to let tears form at the corner of her eyes. It felt like she was barely keeping her head and hands above water at this point.

Darn it, come on! What's going on?! WHO ARE YOU?!

Xion's eyes widened. That was Roxas's voice! But where was it coming from? It wasn't from anywhere in Sora, but that had to mean he was somewhere! Briefly, she could see this image of Roxas in a hazy place, holding his head in anguish as if something was coming to mind.

Were....his words for her? Was he trying to remember her? She had this weird feeling his words were aimed at her.

"Roxas! I'm over here!" Xion tried extending her hand out as far as she could. Was he okay? And was Sora okay? Both questions seemed to be answered in the positive, but that just confused her even more. "I'm....right here....."

The strength in her voice seemed to wane as she was getting pulled under again, any forming tears getting mixed in with her surroundings. If he was there, then she wanted to be where he was. She had hoped they would be together once inside Sora, but if he was there, then she wanted to be there too!

As her outstretched hand began to get submerged too, a bright light began to form, confusing Xion even more. She didn't even really have time to digest what was going on, before whatever it was was beginning to engulf her. For a moment, Xion could see her form disappearing. Actually, it kind of reminded her of when she vanished in Roxas's arms back in Twilight Town.

"Am....I...vanishing again? But...why does it feel warm?" Xion wondered.

The light continued to engulf Xion, her form lighting up before dissipating, not leaving a trace behind.

Twilight Town Mansion

At the same time, the remaining replica body had been glowing as brightly as those that came before it. The combined cries of Roxas and Sora were calling out to it, with it's new occupant on its way. Once that hit, the body burst into even greater light, before being sent on its way. The final resident of the mansion had left.

Mysterious Tower

This time, Donald was actually trying to cast some magic to heal Sora and Roxas, though it was not really helping. Roxas continued to clutch his head, while things had slowly become more apparent with Sora. Goofy and Mickey were especially worried as to what was helping, while Yen Sid tried to ponder what was happening specifically. The last time it happened, Roxas appeared. So, what could this reaction be towards?

They didn't have to wait long for an answer, as a bright light began to appear off to the side, getting everyone's attention. Roxas and Sora's problems seemed to subside for a bit, allowing the two to catch their breath and stand up. Like with Roxas, the light began to take on a distinctive form. Though, for this particular one, the being seemed a little smaller than Roxas. However, what stood out was the prominent black.

"Another one?!" Donald quaked, getting ready just in case.

"I hope it's friendly," Goofy worried as well.

The light began to die down completely, showing off the black-coated figure. The person's features gave off sort of a feminine vibe, although no one could say with certainty. Sora and Roxas looked to each other, before getting a little closer to the figure. Neither drew their Keyblades.

"A friend?" Sora asked.

"I....think so..." Roxas said, his head still feeling all kinds of wobbly at the moment.

The black-coated being barely moved an inch, soft breathing being the only sense of movement so far. Sora and Roxas walked right up to it, trying to get a closer look. They could only see the bottom half of the figure's face, giving Roxas a serious case of deja vu. This...felt very familiar. It was on the tip of his tongue but he couldn't quite get it out.

"Are you.....?" he began to say.

At that, the being showed a little movement for the first time, its face slightly turning towards Roxas. Though the hood, Roxas could see a pair of stunning blue eyes.
1553412111111111111111.title: Continue

15534121111111111111111.content:
"Xion!" Roxas suddenly cried out.

Honestly, that name just came to him, like a flash of inspiration or whatever. Xion didn't seem to indicate much that she heard what he said though. Even he wasn't entirely sure what it meant. All he could say was that....it felt nice to say that name.

"Xion?" Sora asked. "That her name?"

"Yeah, it is," Roxas said after a little pause. "Sorry...my head still feels a little foggy on the details, but....I just feel like she was a friend."

Truth be told, there was one little thing that was actually crystal clear in Roxas's head. A memory of being within the big room where all of the Organization XIII members sat in elevated chairs. Xemnas was, of course, leading the meeting, acting like it was a really big occasion...

Yeah, he could hear Xemnas's booming voice, telling them all that it was a momentous occassion. A new Organization member was coming: Number XIV. Quite an odd number given the name of the Organization to begin with. Further more, it was another one of the Keyblade's chosen, giving Roxas his own thoughts regarding his recruitment. The new figure said not a word, yet happened to look up at Roxas. Slowly, a soft smile formed, and Roxas could swear it was directly at him.

"Roxas? Hello?" Sora waved his hand in front of Roxas's face, snapping him out of it.

"Oh, uh, sorry," Roxas said. "Got lost in memories a little bit."

Xion hadn't moved since they approached. In her mind, everything seemed foggy. Xion was definitely her name, she could say that much. A lot of everything else though was hazy. Still, seeing the two guys in front of her, there was a peaceful feeling. Sora and Roxas, she could tell those names too. They both sounded nice, Roxas especially.

"So where in the world did she come from?" Donald stomped over. "You didn't have her in your heart too, did you?"

"Um, I'm not sure?" Sora questioned.

Donald whined a little, before coming even closer. Before the duck could get too close to Xion though, she subtly moved behind Roxas, making no dramatic movements but clearly keeping a certain distance from the frustrated duck, who grew even more so at being blocked off. Goofy ended up laughing.

"Aw, I think she's shy," Goofy laughed.

"You don't say," Donald grumbled.

Even trying to walk around Roxas just made Xion subtly move in a circle. For a brief moment actually, she actually moved her hand to rest on Roxas's for a brief moment before removing it. Roxas was a little surprised by the brief touch, but shook it off.

"Okay Donald, knock it off," Roxas said. "She clearly doesn't want to be near you."

Donald grumbled indignantly, while Sora and Goofy laughed. Mickey chuckled a little too, though he couldn't help but wonder. He thought back to when Riku told him about a weapon the Organization was preparing to use Sora's powers. He wasn't referring to Roxas, that much he knew. Could this girl be the other one? Eh, guess it was nothing but a wild guess at the moment.

At that, Yen Sid cleared his throat.

"As much as I'm curious of this myself, I believe we should complete our discussion," he said. "There will be time to catch up once we're done."

"Fair point," Sora said. "You don't mind do you Roxas?"

"No, it's okay," Roxas said, understanding that other things did need to be said. He looked behind his right arm to Xion. "You going to be okay?"

She didn't give a verbal response, but there was a very slight tilt of her head that seemed to indicate she understood. Actually, after she did that, Roxas could see a faint smile on her face, very much like what he remembered from the first time he laid eyes on her. Honestly, it was a nice feeling.

In any case, with Xion's matter put aside for the time being, the focus went back to the images of the Organization members present. Yen Sid already went over a couple more things, like it was the Organization causing the Heartless to appear in many worlds. That matched Roxas's own story about them wanting to put Kingdom Hearts together. Behind him, Roxas actually felt Xion stiffen just a little at the mention of Kingdom Hearts.

Frankly, she was also staring a little at the three projections. Roxas couldn't tell if she was fearful or anything, but her blue eyes seemed to indicate a twinkling of distress. In turn, Roxas moved his hand to touch her a little, perhaps as a little reassurance. Again, there was no verbal response, but she seemed to relax a little.

On the other side of things, Yen Sid had been studying the projections intently. In particular, it was Xemnas he was curious about. The Nobody resembled someone he was familiar with. Another of the Keyblade Trio who was lost long ago.

"Mickey, you're familiar with Terra are you not?" Yen Sid asked.

"Aqua and Ven's friend? Yeah, I've heard of him," Mickey said. "Though I didn't get to see him."

"Well, going by Roxas's memories, this Xemnas looks very much like him," Yen Sid closed his eyes in thought. Looks like they really were stumbling upon something far deeper than they imagined. "I believe we may have discovered where Xehanort went following the battle in the Keyblade Graveyard."

Mickey gasped at that, while everyone else was confused.

"Um, Xehanort? Keyblade Graveyard?" asked Sora. "I don't follow."

"It's a long story," sighed Mickey. "But I suppose you probably would have heard it eventually. Allow me."

So, Mickey began recounting what he could. About how there were three particular Keyblade wielders from a decade ago: Ven, Terra, and Aqua. All three were trained by a professional master, much like Mickey was under Yen Sid. Xehanort was also an old master, a dear friend to the trio's own teacher, Eraqus. However, he had plans of his own, and this culminated in a fight at the Keyblade Graveyard, the site of an ancient war between many Keyblade wielders. Mickey didn't know too many specifics beyond when he had to help Aqua fight Ven, who had been possessed by a dark force.

"From what we can gather here, Terra must have been possessed by Xehanort," Yen Sid explained. "Eventually, this person would come to be the apprentice of Ansem the Wise."

"Ansem?!" Sora cried out. "So he's related to that guy from before?"

"That's actually something else I wanted to tell you," Mickey said. "That wasn't Ansem you fought, it was Xehanort. Additionally, it was his Heartless that you defeated."

"Ah, so that's why his Nobody is in charge of the Organization," Roxas added.

"Sounds likely to me," Mickey agreed. "I've hoped for years to be able to find my friends. I figured a time would come eventually, though I didn't imagine it happening now."

Sora thought about everything. So an old friend was possessed? It reminded him of Riku from his first journey. If this Terra had been going under the same thing except for even longer, Sora couldn't help but feel sad for him and Mickey's other friends.

"So, we should go save them!" Sora cheered, to which Donald and Goofy joined it. Mickey chuckled a little.

"That's nice of you Sora. However, you can't chase two rabbits at once," he said. "I'd love to find my friends, but we have pressing matters with the Organization to handle first."

"I guess you're right," Sora nodded, a little sad but he understood.

Then, Yen Sid spoke up. "As an additional measure, since you now have an idea of what Ven and Terra look like, this is Master Aqua."

At that, the Organiation member's projections disappeared, and were replaced by one figure. It was a rather beautiful woman, with short blue hair and wearing blue and black-themed clothing. She had a rather light pair of armor on as well. Honestly, Sora couldn't help but be reminded of Kairi by looking at her. Though, Yen Sid said something funny.

"Master? You mean like you?" he asked.

"Correct. Before her disappearance, Aqua was given the title of Keyblade Master," Yen Sid explained. "She's been lost ever since though."

At that, Aqua's image disappeared, giving the room with just it's living occupants.

"So, now you know what you're up against," Yen Sid said. "Admittedly, I didn't expect so many revelations to come forth today. Yet, as I said before, everything is connected."

"Yes, sir," Sora smiled, Donald and Goofy doing the same.

At that, Yen Sid turned to Roxas.

"Young Roxas, if you find it agreeable, it'd be helpful for you to assist Sora," he requested. "I find it best that you two stay together."

"I was going to anyway," Roxas smirked a little. "Someone's got to keep him safe from his good intentions."

"Hey!" Sora cried indignantly, getting more laughs from everyone around, Xion excluded of course.
15534121111111111111111.title: Continue

155341211111111111111111.content:
After the little bout of laughter subsided, Roxas spoke up again, this time a little more serious.

"What about Xion though?" he asked, looking back at her. "I...don't want to leave her on her own."

"Hmm....I confess I know very little of her situation," Yen Sid pondered before turning to Mickey. "Since she doesn't seem willing to communicate to us, what do you know of her, Roxas?"

"Well....um...." Truth be told, Roxas actually couldn't say much. He knew her name, and that she was close to him. At least closer than anyone in the Organization not named Axel. "I guess.....there isn't too much I know outside of I just know her. She was No.XIV in the Organization....and she can use the Keyblade too."

"Really?" Sora's eyes widened a little. "Her too?"

"Yeah....I'm pretty sure she can. I'm sure I remember Xemnas saying she could, at least as far as my memory goes," Roxas said, before turning to her. "Xion, can you show them?"

Xion seemed to hum a little, though there was a slight tilt of her head. Roxas wasn't sure if she was understanding what he was saying. Sora seemed to be in thought too, before his face lit up like a light-bulb.

"Oh, maybe she just needs to remember. Let's show her," he smiled, putting his hand out and summoning his Keyblade. Roxas nodded at Sora's surprise good thinking, and summoned his own Kingdom Key in turn.

Xion looked at both keys, resting in the right hands of their wielders. Slowly, she turned to her own right hand, raising it a little as if it was alien to her. Still, she mimicked the motion that the two boys did, putting her hand out in front of her. She wasn't sure if she was doing anything, but the image of their keys stayed in her mind, so she focused on that. A brief flicker of light later, a third Kingdom Key formed, much to the delight of Sora and Roxas. Mickey didn't seem surprised, but Donald and Goofy were.

"What?!" Donald cried out. "She can use it too?!"

"It's the same as Sora's key!" Goofy said with a smile, not seeing anything particularly wrong with that. "Does that mean something though?"

Sora was admittedly curious too. Roxas didn't seem to think much on it, but Sora was kind of confused. Roxas using his Keyblade made sense because he was his Nobody. But, why did this girl have the same key? Maybe she was related to him somehow? Honestly, this was kind of gnawing on his mind, so he approached her. Xion's Keyblade disappeared, and she looked up as Sora walked right up to her. She blinked in curiosity at what he was looking at.

Honestly, Xion's eyes were really getting at Sora. He...he knew those eyes from somewhere. They reminded him of someone more special than anyone else. He hoped he wasn't overstepping his bounds, but he had to know.

"Um, if it's okay," Sora began. "Can you put down your hood? I really want to see your face."

The rest of the room was curious at Sora's sudden request. Wasn't really like him to be that upfront. Something must have been really bothering him. Still, everyone's eyes went to Xion at his words, and the girl seemed suddenly a little stiffer. She didn't betray any emotions, but...there seemed like a little hesitation. Still, about a little bit later, her hands began to pull at the edges of her hood, letting it fall down and revealing a head of short raven black hair.

However, the hair wasn't what caught everyone off-guard, except for Roxas who didn't seem surprised.

"Kairi?!" Sora cried out. No way, that was definitely Kairi's face. Heck, if the hair was red instead of black, it would have been a perfect match.

"Why does she look like her?!" cried Donald.

"I'm so confused," groaned Goofy.

Mickey's face lit up in surprise too, and he began to ponder even more at what was going on. Now he felt certain that Xion was the "copy of Sora" that Riku mentioned, though why she had Kairi's appearance had him a little baffled. That would explain why she had Sora's Keyblade. Roxas seemed to be especially close to her, given his reaction both before and after her appearance. He was sure he was beginning to see the bigger picture here.

Perhaps sensing everyone's surprise, Xion wasted little time in putting her hood back on, even turning her head away to hide her face completely as if ashamed.

"Hey, it's okay," Roxas smiled, putting his arms on her shoulders reassuringly. "See, told you she can use the Keyblade."

"Intriguing discovery," Yen Sid said, closing his eyes for a minute. "Then, so answer your question Roxas, I believe she should go along with you and Sora. I believe the three of you shouldn't be kept apart, and it might help to spur your development faster."

"Good," nodded Roxas with a smile, before turning to Xion. "Hey, looks like we're teaming up."

Xion slowly turned to Roxas's gaze. Again, she spoke no words but that smile from before came back. Teaming up....that sounded nice...and a little familiar, but mostly nice. As if to punctuate the situation, Sora came right over and put his arms over both of their shoulders, startling both of them.

"Then we're a team!" Sora grinned his classic grin. "I admit I'm a little confused, but I look forward to our new adventure!"

"You're hopeless," Roxas sighed. Boy, this guy really was going to need protection. Xion's smile didn't leave her face throughout the exchange.

As nice as the scene was though, Donald had a complaint.

"But wait, I don't think Gummi Ships can hold this many people," he said.

"Oh, that's right. It's not very comfortable with more than three people," Goofy nodded sadly. "You wonder why they don't make them bigger."

At that, Mickey chuckled, stepping forward.

"Well, fortunate for us, I may have an idea. It's actually the original reason I came back here in the first place," smiled Mickey. "Remember what Roxas said about Namine? Well, she's currently missing and the Organization might be behind it. I told Riku I'd help search for her, but with the way things are, I might need more help than I thought."

With that, he looked his friends straight in the eyes.

"So Donald, Goofy, how would you like to come with me?" he offered, getting gasps from his friends.

"A mission with the King?!" Donald quaked.

"It's an honor, sir!" Goofy gave a salute, which just looked funny from him. "But, do you think Sora will be okay without us?"

"What do you mean? I can take care of myself, and I got these guys with me," Sora smiled. Leaving Donald and Goofy would be a little sad, but he knew they'd love to help their King more. "So go on. The King needs you, right?"

Donald and Goofy stiffened a little, before soon nodding with smiles. It wasn't like they were being thrown aside. This would be an important mission as well. If their King needed them this urgently, then they would answer the call. Yen Sid nodded too.

"In that case...." He turned to the window. Soon enough, a blocky ship came into view, one immediately recognized as the Gummi Ship they used. "Allow me to return your ship. I retrieved it from the deep darkness for this occasion."

"WOAH! Thanks Master Yen Sid!" Donald quaked, before looking just a little bit irritated as he pulled some keys from his pocket. "Now you better not crash it!"

"What makes you think I'll do that?" Sora pouted. "I didn't crash once before!"

"Yes you did!" Donald quaked louder. "You scraped the ship against an asteroid last time!"

"Scraped, not crashed," Sora talking as if he knew what he was talking about. "Trust me, I'll be fine."

"Oh boy," Roxas groaned. Well this just got a whole lot more crazy. Guess moving about the realm of light meant a new way of traveling, and possibly more dangerous depending on your perspective.

There was another brief laugh, before Sora turned towards Mickey.

"Oh! I had been meaning to ask!" Sora said. "What's Riku up to these days?"

"He's....well enough," Mickey said. "He asked me to not give specifics, but just know that he is also fighting hard against the Organization, and to find Namine too."

Sora nodded, satisfied at that answer. Funny enough, when Xion appeared, Sora also got this strange sensation regarding Namine. It wasn't much of a feeling, but he could just tell it was something. Eh, he'd figure it out later.

"Now, before you go on your way, you should go see the three good fairies for more suitable traveling clothes," Yen Sid explained. "Those clothes look a little too small for you, Sora."

"Oh....heh heh...." Sora laughed bashfully, seeing his old outfit looking quite tiny on him now.

"And it would be best for Roxas and Xion to acquire some clothes as well," Yen Sid continued. "Wearing what they have now might attract unwanted attention."

"Fair enough," Roxas nodded. Getting out of the Organization's uniform didn't sound too bad to him.

Xion didn't seem all that on board though, watching from behind Roxas. Her hands gripped slightly, as if unsure as to what to make of that. She heard Yen Sid's words, and felt unease about looking different.
155341211111111111111111.title: Continue

1553412111111111111111111.content:
Xion's unease going a little unnoticed, Sora lead both Roxas and her towards the adjacent room where they needed to go. Mickey brought Donald and Goofy over to him so they could talk things out, as well express some long held-in relief that the King was well. Mickey sure felt lucky to have such caring friends. He felt a little guilty about separating them from Sora when they were about to have another adventure, but he hoped they would be happy with this too. Surely, they'd be traveling quite a bit themselves from here on.

Sora, Roxas, and Xion walked into the next room together, seeing that it was a slightly smaller room than the one they just came from. As always, there were books and stuff all over the place. Near the back of the room though were three women, all smaller than the other three present and wearing vibrant colors of red, green, and blue. The little wings on their back only confirmed what Yen Sid said about fairies. Sora was excited of course, while Roxas couldn't help but think of that little fairy thing from Neverland that made him fly. Hey, come to think of it, Axel got to fly with him but he had the feeling Xion didn't. Maybe they should make a note of that for the future.

Before the three of them could speak though, the fairies noticed them, breaking from their little huddle.

"Ah, if it isn't Sora. A delightful pleasure to meet you," smiled the red fairy. "My name is Flora."

"I'm Fauna. Also a pleasure," replied the green fairy.

"And I'm Merryweather. The honor's all mine," said the blue fairy in turn.

"I'm Sora...but I guess you knew that already," Sora chuckled sheepishly, putting his hands behind his head.

"Roxas," Roxas replied simply, before turning to Xion. "Come on. You gotta at least introduce yourself right?"

Xion gently turned to Roxas, who was standing on Sora's right side while she was to the left. Her mouth moved slightly, but no words came out, as if she didn't trust her voice. Still, Roxas was right. She had a name. Why not tell it?

"....Xion," she spoke her first words since re-awakening. Even her voice was exactly like Kairi's were Sora's thoughts, really making him wonder what the story was there.

"Splendid!" Flora said in turn. "We're already aware that you're here for better clothes."

"And you've come to the right place!" Merryweather smiled in delight. "Though I must say, your new company was unexpected."

"Indeed. We actually had something in mind for you, Donald, and Goofy," Flora said, tapping her wand a little. "Our idea was for you to gain powers based on your bond with them. With your new companions, we'll have to think of something new for you, as well as for your fellow Keyblade wielders in turn."

"Really?" Sora asked, looking a little disappointed at perhaps throwing a wrench into things. "I'm sorry for that. Things just happened."

"Oh it's no worry at all," laughed Fauna. "We'll simply just have to work with your new company. We'll just take you, Roxas, and Xion's abilities into account when making the new designs."

"Ohhh, does this mean we get to use my idea?!" Merryweather said with a lot of excitement.

"We'll talk, dear," Flora said. "We have to be sure Sora can handle that sort of power. If you can excuse us dears for a few minutes so we can discuss this."

"Oh, it's no problem. Right?" Sora glanced at his two companions, who both nodded slightly.

"Splendid," Flora tapped her wand again. "Let's just get a better look at your companions so we know what to do for them."

Fauna walked over and looked around Xion, tapping her wand and humming a bit. Xion seemed a little off-put at the sudden scrutinizing, making her want to hide behind Sora and Roxas again. Thankfully, Fauna's work didn't take too long. Merryweather took the task of looking over Roxas.

"If it's not too much trouble, there is something I'd like for my clothes," Roxas said. "There's some I wore in Twilight Town that I liked..."

"Oh, I know," Merryweather laughed. "I already looked into your memories to see that."

"Is everyone here capable of invading my head?" Roxas thought bitterly as Merryweather eventually left him alone.

The three fairies went back to their little huddle, allowing the three Keyblade wielders by themselves near the entrance to the room. Guess they had a little bit of time before getting on the road. At the very least though, Sora wanted to keep talking.

"So....I'm guessing you don't have any idea either how you got here?" he asked.

"Nope," Roxas shrugged. "How in the world we're able to look at each other like this is beyond me. Probably the same for Xion too."

Said girl just hung around behind the boys, not saying anything but just lingering behind as if wanting to avoid being seen. The boys didn't think much of it, though Roxas felt concerned with her shyness. It wasn't this bad before....was it? Xion kept to herself in the Organization, he could remember that much, yet she didn't act like this. Well, hopefully he could get to the bottom of that in time. All he knew was that he felt delighted for her to be back.

"I see.....you know, I think we should have a little spar before we go," Sora smiled again. "Feel each other out so we'll be able to fight better in the other worlds."

"Hmm, not a bad idea," Roxas nodded. "I think all three of us have some catching up to do in regards to skill."

"Awesome," Sora smiled, before turning to Xion. "You in too?"

Xion lightly turned in Sora's direction, giving a small nod, although her head really wasn't much clearer in regards to anything. It didn't seem like something that was going to come to her any time soon. Well, Sora didn't really want to pry any more than he already did. He was okay with her waiting for a time she wanted to talk.

"In any case, this is going to be interesting," Sora smiled again. "Not one, but three Keyblade wielders on a journey."

"True, but don't forget it'll probably be hard," Roxas said gravely. "I already tried taking on the Organization once and couldn't get through the front door. We'll have to get a lot stronger for that."

"Right," Sora nodded, none of his enthusiasm fading. "But I'm positive we can handle it."

Roxas shook his head but smiled all the same. Guess if nothing else, Sora could keep group motivation going. They couldn't see, but Xion also smiled softly beneath her hood. At that same time, the fairies broke their huddle, seeming pretty satisfied.

"All right dears, let's get to work!" Flora said, getting everyone's attention. "Sora, let's start with you. We're going to keep the design we had in mind for you, but what powers they grant will be very different compared to what we were planning."

"You should keep in mind that they're going to be stronger than what we originally had in mind," said Fauna. "So, please exercise caution when learning them."

"Got i t!" Sora smiled with a clenched fist. No matter what, he could take it.

Sadly, Sora found his enthusiasm waning at what happened next. It started simply with Fauna giving him a set of better fitting clothes, with a distinct green color scheme at that. Merryweather didn't like it though and promptly turned it blue. He wasn't sure if Flora was trying to help but she turned it red right afterwards. What followed was a never ending struggle between the three fairies who kept hitting Sora with magic over and over again.

It was actually getting to a point where Roxas was beginning to laugh, and he just got louder as the struggle went on. Off to the side, Xion had a hand over her mouth, not being able to stop softly giggling herself. She wasn't quite sure why she was doing that, but it felt nice so why not. Sora groaned as his companion's apparent enjoyment of this, eventually asking the fairies to please just decide already. That got them out of their little competition, finally settling enough to actually cooperate.

What eventually came out of it was a nice set of clothing that seemed to emphasize black, along with some yellow and red. It suited him rather well, and Sora even caught a glimpse in the nearby mirror, even posing playfully into it that drew eye-rolls from Roxas. Eventually, Flora pulled him out of his fun, reiterating that the clothes were special. Flora conjured up a little something for Sora to take, which he did obviously.

"As I said, this is a little stronger than what we had originally thought of, so be careful," Flora said before she conjured up something else, a little crescent moon shaped like a....keychain? "Take this. King Mickey once used a blade like this so you should make use of it."

Honestly, Sora had completely forgotten about his keychains. That was really helpful in his last journey through the worlds. He took the keychain willingly, setting it to his Keyblade. It transformed into the Star Seeker, a Keyblade Mickey once used as implied by Flora.

"And now, watch what happens!" Merryweather said with excitement.

Sora felt a rush of power go through him after a little while, the force coming off as incredibly strong, encasing part of him in light. Roxas actually took a step back in surprise, wondering what this was. When the light died down though, Sora opened his eyes, startled to see bits of his clothes had turned a dark green. Furthermore, Star Seeker had turned into a more sword-like shape, glittering stars falling from its edge.

"Oh wow......man!" Sora said, once he got his bearings. Seriously, this was cool! His Keyblade actually changed!
1553412111111111111111111.title: Continue

15534121111111111111111111.content:
Both Roxas and Xion were quite intrigued by the change. They certainly hadn't seen anything like that. It seemed pretty strong too.

"This is called Blitz Form. It's one of many forms you'll be able to take on depending on what Keyblade you're using," Merryweather explained. Clearly this was her idea to an extent. "We're not telling you the rest. You'll have to discover those on your own."

"We will add one little nugget of information," said Fauna. "We added a little feature where you can have up to three keychains available at one time, so you can adjust your Keyblade even when in battle."

Okay, that excited Sora as much as the new form did. He remembered how he sometimes had a less convenient keychain during certain battles and he never had enough time to change unless the battle was over. Having more options like this was pretty cool. Admittedly, he also felt a little tired too, and his clothes ended up reverting back to normal, Star Seeker changing back as well. Okay, he was kind of already starting to see why Flora was a little weary about it. He was going to have to toughen up to handle that stuff for longer periods.

"Like I advised, use it wisely," Flora said strictly. "Don't go overboard if your body isn't capable yet."

"Got it," Sora smiled. Eh, he felt no biggie at that. If he had to get better, then he would. Simple as that.

"All right then. Roxas you're next," Flora beckoned him to come over.

With Sora's time in the spotlight done for now, Roxas walked right up. Thankfully, the fairies wasted little time in actually getting their act together and doused him with their magic as well. Much to Roxas's delight, they had taken to heart what he asked, and was soon looking at a new set of clothes resembling what he wore before outside of the Organization. Although, he could already feel something radiating off them, not something he ever felt with his old clothes.

"For you Roxas, and this applies to Xion as well, we had to figure out the correct balance for the three of you to use your skills to the best they can be. After all, you won't get anywhere if all three of you focus on the same abilities. It's bad for chemistry," Merryweather explained. "So, in Roxas's case, we gave you one of the powers we intended to give Sora. It's called Valor."

"Valor...." Roxas quoted, giving his new (old?) look a glance in the mirror.

"The fact that you already use two Keyblades makes you perfect for this. It's a battle-oriented form meant for attacking and protecting," said Fauna. "And like Sora, you may be able to tap into more of its power."
