Roxas could indeed feel something inside him, and having already experienced an awakening of his own some time ago, was even able to summon a little bit of it. He even noticed a symbol, seeing a red fleur-de-lis symbol. Guess that was the representative of Valor's power in these clothes. Not bad at all.

"Thank you," Roxas smiled. Being out of the Organization's cloak felt pretty nice right now. He walked back over to Sora.

"Gotta say, that does look more fitting on you than all black," Sora chuckled.

"Sure, laugh it up," Roxas shook his head, though his own smile remained.

"All right, last but certainly not least," announced Fauna. "Xion, your turn dear."

Xion's head piped up at her being called, to which she was slow to move. Roxas looked over to her, smiling as if telling her it was okay. She didn't respond but began to walk forward towards where the others were standing, her hands folded over in front of her as she waited.

"All right, once more dears," Flora said, and the three fairies got to work again.

A slight noise escaped Xion's mouth as the magic hit her. Like the others, the magic took effect immediately, completely transforming her clothes. Her cloak disappeared, giving her a double-buttoned black top. It was sleeveless, had a bit of a collar, and tiny frills on the arms. A large black belt went around her waist, and a white skirt filled out from underneath it. Completely the surprisingly simple outfit were black boats that went halfway up the knees with a little beige at the top of them. The heels on them also mirrored the ones from her cloak.

"Woah, nice!" Sora cheered on, a completely innocent gesture. The new clothes gave him a far better look, really showing off how much she resembled Kairi. Granted, it wasn't like he really cared honestly. He was just happy for her.

Roxas was actually silent, his mouth slightly open. This was the first time he had ever seen Xion in anything out of her cloak, and....wow....what word could he think that described her? He actually couldn't think of one. In his lifetime (not counting Sora's life), he had only seen one girl outside of an Organization's cloak and that was Olette. Yet...a thought rang through his head that she didn't look nearly as good as Xion did. Where did that thought even come from?

In Xion's case, what came of her mouth was a soft muttering of intelligible words. Seeing her new form in the mirror, she couldn't but feel....a little wrong somehow. She wanted to hide her face again, but the new clothes didn't have a hood, and she had so much skin showing compared to how she was before. Plus, getting to look in the mirror and seeing her Kairi-influenced form in greater detail, she couldn't help this odd feeling of distress. Like...something was wrong.

The fairies just took it as her being a little shy and thought nothing big of it. Like Roxas's clothes, Xion could see a symbol associated with its powers: a blue flame.

"For you Xion, these clothes will enhance your magical abilities. We call it Wisdom," explained Flora. "Since Donald won't be joining you, you'll need someone to better assist you with magic and healing and the like. So your job won't be just to assist them with fighting, but also to keep everyone healed and healthy."

"Y-Yes...." Xion spoke softly, before turning to go back to the others since she assumed she was done now.

"Well now, I'd say you're all ready to go," smiled Flora. "I wish you all the best of luck."

"This journey is going to be twice as hard as your last one," said Merryweather. "So you two do your best to help him."

"We'll try," smiled Roxas. "Right Xion?"

As weird as Xion felt about a lot of things, seeing Roxas's smile seemed to alleviate things just a little. She actually gave a little smile, and nodded slightly. Sora pouted a little bit bit returned to his usual smile fast enough. They all said their thanks to the three fairies, and returned outside to the others. Donald noticed them immediately, saying they didn't look bad in their clothes. He had another matter to discuss though.

"Take these," he quaked, handing out three little accessories to the trio.

"What are these?" Sora asked.

"I gave them some of my magic. They'll help to make sure you blend into the worlds since I won't be there," said Donald, taping his foot a little. "You do know why, right?"

"Yeah yeah, the world order," Sora sighed. "I got it the first time you said it."

"No you didn't," Donald quaked a little louder.

Everyone got a little laugh at that, before Mickey came over.

"Well, it's about time for us to depart," Mickey smiled before offering his hand. "I wish you all the best Sora, Roxas, Xion."

"We'll do it Your Majesty," Sora smiled and gave the King a handshake. "You traveling in a Gummi Ship too?"

"Yep, I've got one I've been using. It's been kind of lonely too, so it'll be nice to have company," laughed Mickey.

"Welp, take care Sora!" Goofy came over and engulfed him in a big hug. "We'll miss you!"

"I'll miss you too, Goofy!" Sora laughed and returned the hug.

"And you two get one too!" Goofy laughed as he turned and gave Roxas a big hug, to which he awkwardly returned and smiled all the same. Then he hugged Xion too, who's face went a little red at the close contact, but she eventually returned the hug too.

"Now, as a word of advise, the worlds have returned to how they were before thanks to you guys," explained Mickey. "But don't worry, you'll be able to find new pathways to them. Worlds are always tied, just like our hearts. The Keyblade shall be your guide."

"May your heart be your guiding key," Goofy said, laughing a little. "I like that line."

"Oh, I like that too," Sora smiled. "Where did that come from?"

"Oh, it's a really old saying among Keyblade Masters. Truthfully not many recite those words," Mickey laughed a little. "But it's very true all the same."

"May your heart be your guiding key...." Roxas quoted.

Roxas felt curious about it. He was pretty self-assured in his own heart, probably more than most Nobodies. And yet, he was basically setting out on the journey as truly his own person. No Organization XIII to give him missions. No forced missions. No more having Sora over his head. In a way of speaking, this was the first time that he actually didn't have a direction, other than knowing he wanted to take the Organization down.

To his left, he actually heard Xion recite the same words. He smiled a little.

"Looks like we have a long journey ahead," said Roxas to her. "So, you ready to see where our hearts lead?"

Xion stared at him, before hanging her head a little. Hearts....was that something she had? The word sounded nice. If Roxas had one, then it'd be nice if she had one too. Somehow it felt like there was a little bit of dread hanging over such a thing in her head, but seeing Roxas looking at her made her feel at ease about it.

"Yes," she said finally, a slightly wider smile forming.
15534121111111111111111111.title: Continue

155341211111111111111111111.content:
So, it was finally time to say farewell to Mickey, Donald, and Goofy for now. Granted, Donald continued to take every opportunity he could to make sure Sora knew everything about the Gummi ship controls, to which Sora continued to plead that he got it already. The bickering between the two was pretty amusing in all honesty.

The group gave Master Yen Sid one last wave of farewell before he took his own leave, and they descended down the tower. To the delight of everyone, Pete had been long gone at that point, avoiding another weird confrontation with him. With one last good bye, the Mickey trio were on their way in the King's own ship.

"Good luck!" called Mickey.

"You too! Bye!" Sora waved at them, Roxas giving a wave of his own while Xion mostly remained still.

Before long, the King's ship flew out of sight, into the ocean between worlds. Sora exhaled a breath. This was really happening. Another adventure, and with his own Nobody at that. Plus....a girl in which he really had zero idea what the relation was. Oh well, like it really mattered. Whoever Xion was, at least she had her own body. All that aside though, there was another thing Sora was rather giddy for.

One last thing before they got on their way.

"So, how about that practice before we go?" smiled Sora. "Got plenty of room for it out here."

"Sure, why not," Roxas smiled back. "I probably got a little rusty being in you for so long."

"Hey, it's been only hours since I woke up!" Sora pouted a little.

"Felt like weeks to me," Roxas shrugged.

The bickering was short-lived before both of them were ready to go. They took the the time to explain to Xion she could have her turn after them. Giving only a slight nod, she waited along the wall of the tower, seemingly content to watch for now.

A little time later

"Hah!" grunted Sora.

"Tah!" yelled Roxas right back.

The two boys had been going back and forth for a little while now, getting a pretty good idea of how the other fought. Granted, it wasn't like there were completely different styles. Many of them shared similar moves, though there were some variances given their different backgrounds. What was also clearly evident was the difference in their attitude, because Roxas was clearly the more aggressive one when it came to direct combat. Sora was overall the more balanced one by comparison. As an added note, Sora wasn't getting into the Drive forms, as they figured it wasn't too necessary.

Oh, and they weren't going too crazy either, as much as Roxas kind of wanted to go deeper into his bag of light-based attacks.

"Gotta admit, I didn't know you could do that!" Roxas cried out as he had another Oathkeeper strike blocked.

A short second ago, Roxas thought he had Sora pretty beat when he knocked Kingdom Key away, but Sora called it back to him just in time to block another strike. That caught Roxas off-guard, giving Sora more than enough time to fight back. Sora was actually feeling pretty comfortable now, given his new clothing. It seemed like it wasn't taking too long for him to get back to a respectable level.

"Kind of nice for me to be the smart one for once," Sora grinned.

"Don't push your luck," Roxas smirked back.

Meanwhile, as the two continued their little spar, Xion continued to watch them, taking it all in. Although, the more she watched, the more she seemed to tense up. Seeing two Keyblades clashing against each other.....was making her feel strange for some reason. She cringed a little as her head seemed to throb slightly. She wasn't sure what was going on, but there was a feeling of dread in there. She involuntarily gulped, not sure what to make of these sensations.

"So, you got any other of those keychains then?" Roxas asked Sora as their spar winded down, as neither wanted to exhaust the other too much before they had to go.

"Well, when I journeyed before, I got loads!" Sora smiled before it lessened. "But...it doesn't seem like I have them anymore."

Before their spar, Sora had taken a look at his keychains, wanting to remind himself. However, aside from his usual Kingdom Key, there were no others. Granted, he still thankfully had Kairi's charm with him, which still granted Oathkeeper. He even tried it out a little, which made clashing it against Roxas's own a little strange before he swapped it out.

"Wonder why that is. Think it's just a case of you losing them somewhere?" Roxas asked.

"If it was one or two, maybe, but all of them? I doubt it," Sora pondered. "Although, with all that talk of my own memories getting messed up, perhaps that had something to do with it."

"Guess it makes sense," Roxas said. "Back in the Organization, I didn't get Keyblades like that. There was this weird little creature that gave me items to change my Keyblade depending on what I needed."

"Heh, I could have probably used that," Sora grinned. "That could have made my early journey so much easier."

"Uh huh...." Roxas thought, chuckling a little. Still, Roxas felt a little glad to be away from that, being able to use his Keyblade in the way he liked now. In any case, it was time to move on. Roxas wanted to get Xion involved. "Hey Xion! Want to go against me next?"

Xion was taken out of her little stupor, nodding slightly as she slowly moved from her little spot against the tower. Sora took a spot over to the side, pretty curious to see his two new companions would do against each other. Roxas kept his Keyblades drawn, while Xion drew her own, taking on a stance that felt instinctively natural. Roxas got himself ready too, feeling more than warmed up now. His dual-wielding style was part of why he was given the Valor power from the fairies, but he needed to get better at it since he wasn't always going to be fighting on adrenaline.

"You know, I get the feeling we never practiced against each other. Guess we should make up for lost time then," Roxas said. At least, he had a feeling they never practiced against each other, though there was something nagging in his brain about it.

Xion actually felt a little strange too, but soon enough their spar got started. Granted, Roxas didn't go all out, as it was clearly evident that Xion was really starting from the bottom here, only striking Roxas with basic blows. At the very least, while her mind was playing catch-up, her body still seemed to remember how to fight. As Wisdom granted, she supposedly had increased magic now, which was evident when she instinctively sent a Fire spell his way, followed up quickly by Thunder.

It was a surprisingly exciting match, at least from Sora's view. Roxas's aggressive fighting style going against Xion's magic was quite something to see. To the two combatants though, they couldn't help but feel something odd about this. Each clash of their Keyblades, every use of magic, each made the other's head spin a little. Little did both know they were seeing the same things. Flashes of various worlds seemed to go through their minds, too fast to make anything out of, yet there was one constant: fighting. And for both, the most distinctive one seemed to be Twilight Town.

"Why am I thinking of that?" thought Roxas. "And what is this pressure I'm feeling?"

Meanwhile, Xion's head was actually going a little haywire. She had similar images to Roxas, yet she seemed to be greater affected by it. She...could tell Roxas was in her images...but....something was wrong...something that made her chest hurt. Seeing Roxas charging at her, something about it made her hands tremble...

Get ready, Roxas!

STOP HOLDING BACK!

DING!

Suddenly, Roxas had knocked Xion's Keyblade from her hands, suddenly bringing everything back to the present. Xion wasn't sure what had just happened. What were those words from? It....sounded like her voice...and it mentioned Roxas. Was...there another time they fought or was her brain just playing tricks on her?

"Xion....Hey Xion?!" Roxas's words eventually cut through the haze in her mind. He was kneeling in front of her, helping to keep her steady. Apparently she had fallen on her back after the attack. "Are you okay? I didn't go too hard did I?"

"No....I'm....fine...." Xion said slowly, unaware of the sweat going down her face.

Even this position they were sitting in felt oddly familiar, and for some reason it filled Xion with sadness. She could see Roxas's face, and then it fading from her vision. She didn't know why. There were conflicting feelings, like she wanted something....but it hurt inside to do it....it made no sense really. Absentmindedly, she had lifted her left hand, which was resting on Roxas's check.

Roxas was about to ask what she was doing, and yet he was experiencing similar sensations, like this was familiar. And it felt crushing to do so for some reason. His arm around Xion tensed a little, as if afraid she was going to slip out of it. Eventually though, Xion removed her hand from his face.

"Sorry...." she said.

"Don't be....it's okay..." he said back.

Observing the rather tender moment, Sora wasn't sure what to make of it. Both of them seemed pretty distressed about something. He wished he could but right in and say something, but then again, both of them were dealing with some lost memories of their own. He liked to think maybe they learned something, but they didn't seem happy about it. If anything, they looked really awkward about it.

Eventually, the two of them separated, and all three finished up any last testing out they wanted to do before they got on the Gummi ship. Sora of course lead the charge, giving them the rundown of the place. All the while, he wished he could ask more about what happened. Maybe he could ask Roxas privately.
155341211111111111111111111.title: Continue

1553412111111111111111111111.content:
Sora opened the way to the Gummi ship, allowing his friends to come on board. Suffice to say, Roxas and Xion were a little put-off by the blocky ship. Not that they had seen many ships to begin with, but it just looked really....weird to say the least. Not to mention the fact that it wasn't too big either, though maybe that was a good thing. It'd be a little more cozy, at least that's how Sora justified it.

"Welcome aboard the Highwind," Sora grinned as he sat in the big seat. "Oh, that's my name for it."

"I know. I already saw that in your head," Roxas said, looking around a little.

"So, do you like know everything about me?" Sora asked, slightly miffed about that response.

"Not everything. Seeing your memories just came along with joining with you," Roxas replied, before smirking slightly. "Not that I actually wanted to see your memories. I didn't like the fact that I was there to begin with after all."

"Sorry," Sora replied. Roxas just shook his head, his smile not faltering.

"You don't have to say sorry. I can't help the fact that I was kind of mad, but I know it's not your fault," he said. "I have no clue how Xion or I are here, but I'll take it whatever it is. Let's just stick with that and move forward."

"Got it!" Sora smiled, giving a thumbs up. "So, ready for take-off?"

Roxas took his seat and got buckled in, though they had to give Xion some instructions on what to do. She didn't speak but seemed to be pretty engrossed in the bizarre machine she was in. Once everyone was set, Sora was able to get the ship moving again, giving Roxas and Xion a little shake as they felt a ship moving for the first time.

"This is certainly a lot different than just seeing it in your head," Roxas's voice stuttered a little due to the rumbling. Xion's eyes widened slightly at it.

Sora slowly rose it into the air, though it got a little wobbly as he had to remember which direction was which. Once he was high enough to clear the tower, he put it into drive, pushing the Gummi ship forward and out of the world. Given that this was still connected to Twilight Town, Roxas took one last look back. You could just barely make out Twilight Town's distinctive glow from the horizon.

"That reminds me...those had to be your tears I felt when I got on the train," Sora stated out of the blue. Roxas didn't even need to see his eyes to know what he was talking about.

"Yeah, that was probably me. It's funny, considering in the end I didn't really get to know the real Heyner, Pence, and Olette," Roxas said sadly. "Just those digital versions of them."

"That's why we have to make sure we return, so we can all hang out!" Sora grinned. "You, me, and Xion too."

"Me?" Xion cocked her head slightly.

"True. I'm sure they'd like having you around too," Roxas replied with a smile of his own. Despite not really knowing what or who they were talking about, Xion smiled slightly.

With that, Sora gave the Highwind another boost, and the ship was flung into the ocean between worlds. Unbeknownst to them though, a familiar shadow was growing in the old tower, one that forced the three good fairies to flee for safety. An old enemy was making her return, to which she could only laugh at.

Ocean Between Worlds

To say it was a startling sight would be an understatement. Despite seeing some of it in Sora's heart, witnessing basically outer space was stunning to Roxas. To think that, while he was already doing through the Organization's dark corridors to get from world to world, he was missing out on this the whole time. Probably took longer, but who could deny the view. The stars formed so many constellations, forms of space dust carved out myriad forms, and all the while, there were lights flying around like shooting stars.. Over to his left, Xion had no words, mouth just left wide open at the sight. Taking a brief glance at her, Roxas couldn't help but stifle a little laugh. She was reaching her hand out, as if trying to grab one of those stars herself. There was a certain brightness in her eyes. Who knows if it was from the stars or something else, but when Roxas's eyes met hers for a second as they looked, he couldn't help but feel himself drawn in before she turned away again.

Sora didn't miss that though, actually grinning throughout the whole thing. These two seemed to have quite a lot of baggage going on that neither one could remember, but there seemed to be some sort of affection in there, and he wanted to see more of that. Probably best to not do that in space though.

"Like it?" Sora smiled. "I couldn't believe it myself seeing it for the first time."

"I just...can't believe there's all this between the worlds," Roxas said. "I think I prefer it to the dark corridors."

"What are those like?" Sora asked out of curiosity.

"Well, they're dark...and kind of cold honestly," Roxas. "Granted the coats kind of helped against that. I never thought too much about it before. You probably wouldn't like it."

"Probably not, but who knows," Sora grinned as he leaned back in his chair. "In any case....guess we're not going to be traveling too far. There's only one world on the monitor."

Despite the wondrous sight, Sora was right as they could only see one world in their vision. However, Roxas was quick to point out that it looked familiar, and Sora was able to catch on it too. So, with that in mind, Sora get the Highwind in that direction.

"So Roxas," Sora asked over while Xion was still observing the sights. "What happened during the spar? When you and Xion had your moment?"

"Huh?" Roxas tilted his head until Sora's meaning got through to him. "Oh that.....I'm not sure myself honestly. My head just felt weird as we were fighting, and she was looking a little distressed for some reason. I can't say for sure, but it was like every clash of our Keyblades was bringing something else to mind. And the truth is...I'm not sure if I like it. When we were sitting in that position, I had a sense that we had done that before."

"Really?" Sora asked. "But you didn't like it?"

"It just....feels like it's related to something bad in our pasts," Roxas said. "Perhaps that's related to why my memories regarding her are still scrambled up."

"I see....well hopefully we can bring those back as we journey," Sora said. "You went to many worlds, right? Perhaps we'll run into some you guys went to."

"That'd be nice," Roxas nodded.

"Awesome. So, what about......?" Just as Sora was about to get a little deeper regarding his thoughts with Roxas and Xion, said girl was pointing her right index finger forward, seemingly as calm as ever. "Xion, what's up?"

"Rock...." she said.

"Huh?" Sora asked before turning forward, his eyes widening. "Uh oh!"

By rock, she meant asteroid. And yeah, there were a lot of those too, many of which Sora apparently hadn't thought about when charting the ship's course. Acting a little frantically, he grabbed the controls, getting a little clumsy with how he operated it. Many of the asteroids in front of them were huge, and Sora was having trouble keeping the right controls in mind.

"Hang on!" he cried out, pulling the ship up as it circled around the huge asteroid, only for another huge one to appear. Sora rapidly veered to the right, making the ship spin as their bearings were getting off.

"I thought you said you could drive this!" Roxas cried out.

"Hey, nobody's perfect!" Sora retorted, now struggling to get the Highwind up right again. "I just need to find how to....uh....get this thing upright again."

"You know, if you're going to be clueless about it, I ought to drive!" Roxas said impulsively, even getting out of his seat.

"No way! I still know more than you!" Sora stated back.

"And what you know is going to crash us at this rate!" Roxas said back.

This resulted in a further tussle that had the Hindwind going every which way around asteroids. If not the internal gravity offered by the ship, Roxas would have been tossed into the glass dome of the ship multiple times over. The two boys continued yelling over the controls, while miraculously staying clear of oncoming rocks.

Xion stayed completely silent over this, though if you were to look closely, you see her hands gripping her seat belt, knuckles turning white all the while.

Hollow Bastion

"That....could have gone better," Sora groaned.

The trio landed the Highwind just outside of town, all three a little worse for wear. Sora and Roxas looked like they had been thrown through the ringer, somewhat literally in Roxas's case. While Xion wasn't very vocal about it, it was clear she was in distress herself, part of her face turning a sickly green. Had there been anything in her stomach, she probably would have hurled thanks to the boy's "driving" if one could call it that.

In any case, they got their bearings as quickly as they could, walking into town. Sora couldn't quite put his finger on why the place seemed familiar, until he saw the giant castle.

"It's Hollow Bastion!" Sora cried out.

"Oh, you're right," Roxas said, remembering the castle from Sora's memories. "I don't remember the town though. That had been swallowed up by darkness, right?"

"Yeah, it was," Sora said. "Maybe Leon and the others have returned home by now. You remember them, too?"

"Um.....I'm a little vague on that. I...think you met them early on?" Roxas questioned.

"Right, I met them soon after Desiny Islands fell and I wound up in Traverse Town," Sora smiled. "Come on, let's go see."

And with that, they had arrived in another world.
1553412111111111111111111111.title: Continue

15534121111111111111111111111.content:
All three members of the crew descended down the steps entering town. Roxas had already made note of the Heartless he noticed a minute earlier, making sure the others knew as well. There were a decent amount of people around, many seemingly oblivious to anything around them, which was fine enough for the trio. Along the way though, they came across someone, a duck that reminded Sora of Donald. It was actually Donald's Uncle Scrooge, who seemed to be quite the businessman judging by his attitude. All his talk of ice cream got Roxas really thinking though.

"Hmm....I kind of miss ice cream..." he mumbled. Sora raised an eyebrow while Xion muttered a little herself, even putting a hand to her lips.

"Good memories?" Sora inquired.

"Yeah, Axel and I would get ice cream all the time back in Twilight Town," Roxas smiled, then frowned a little. "I....I'm pretty sure Xion joined us too...but that's kind of blurry right now."

"Ah," nodded Sora before he smiled as well. "Well I'd be down for that. A nice break every now and then would be nice. I didn't get much of a chance to take a break last time."

"Uh huh," chuckled Roxas.

As they kept walking through the marketplace, they occasionally noticed some sort of orb thing appearing and vanishing throughout the area, confusing all of them. As Sora was wondering that though, a female voice shouted to him that it was the town's defense mechanism. Sora smiled at the voice though, remembering it as Yuffie's own. Sadly, the reunion was cut a little bit short by the appearance of some Dusks. It would essentially be the first real fight for the trio on their journey, so it would be good for real experience. Nothing too special was necessary to take on the Dusks, with Sora and Roxas both going through the majority of them while Xion was still working on catching up.

Following this brief battle, Sora finally got to introduce Roxas and Xion to Yuffie, to which the ninja greeted them excitedly. Sora and Yuffie did share a brief laugh at a little imitation he did of Leon, a joke pretty much only they got. Roxas just smiled and shrugged while Xion stood by. Following that, Yuffie got them all over to a house nearby, letting them all inside.

"Meet the Hollow Bastion Restoration Committee!" she cheered dramatically, something Sora really seemed to get into.

Leon, Cid, and Aerith all turned around to greet Sora, happy to once again see the boy they had met in Traverse Town over a year ago. Likewise, Sora was glad to catch up, introducing his two new friends. They had wondered where Donald and Goofy went, to which Sora explained that they were on a new mission. After that, Roxas introduced himself, where as Xion just mumbled her name and ended up walking behind Sora and Roxas. Seeing so many new faces made her really wish she had her hood.

Xion's introduction however brought particular attention to her, catching everyone a little off guard. Even Yuffie didn't notice it immediately.

"Isn't that Kairi? Your friend from last time?" asked Leon.

The question made Xion tilt her head a little bit. That name sounded familiar too.

"Oh her? Nah, she's not Kairi," Sora laughed a little sheepishly, looking to Roxas. "She's.....a relative I guess?"

"Why are you looking at me?" Roxas asked. "How would I know that?"

"Well you know her better than I do," Sora retorted.

The Hollow Bastion crew was justifiably confused at the trio's odd reaction, though they were willing to take Sora's word for it if he was sure. That did have all three of them wondering what that reason was though. She couldn't be Kairi's Nobody, since it was already said that was Namine. So where did Xion come in to the picture? Somehow it felt like the more they went on, the more questions they got. Roxas and Xion both couldn't help but figure they knew why for some reason, where as Sora wasn't even sure where to begin. In any case, they decided to drop it for now. To reason to drag in a potentially delicate subject if it would be avoided.

Sora got a little indignant when they mentioned they only just now recently remembered him, though the whole memory thing that he knew about that made it more understandable to him. It did make Roxas frown a little though. The fact that so many people suffered from incomplete memories over the past year, not just him or Xion or others. Still, at least now hopefully things could begin to feel more like normal. In any case, it wasn't long before Leon asked if they could help out a little bit. Sora quickly signed them up for it before anyone could object, making Roxas sigh. The guy didn't even give it two seconds before deciding to help. Such an act got a "sort-of" compliment from Leon about it.

After basically becoming honorary members of the committee, rather humorously as they mentioned they originally had cards for Donald and Goofy, they got a visit from Merlin. It was kind of bewildering to already be associated with so many people, and this was just their first world after Twilight Town. Apparently, the old wizard was also familiar with how one of Sora's companions looked.

"That you Ven, my boy?" Merlin asked. "My, it's been years and you don't look like you've aged a day. And did you change your hair, Kairi? Why are so many of you youngin's going for the goth look these days? That is the "hip" word around, right?"

"Not again....my name's Roxas," Roxas groaned. Was this going to be a recurring theme? He and Xion constantly having to explain how they look? "I'm not Ven. I just look like him. Don't ask why."

"My name's Xion...." Xion said softly, somewhat copying Roxas's reply. All this Kairi talk didn't seem to be making her feel much better.

"It's complicated," Sora tried to say. "But just...think of him as my brother instead of Ven. And Xion's like a relative of hers...."

Merlin seemed confused, of which no one could blame him. "Well, if you're sure Sora, I won't push it further."

In any case, out of respect for the trio's privacy and to get back to why he was really here, he wanted to touch up on Sora's magic. Guess that had also been returned to rock bottom because of his sleep. In light of that, Merlin graciously allowed Sora to touch up on basic spells again. Roxas smirked at that, thinking that he might as well. Didn't want to make Xion do all the magic work, which made Sora indignant again.

In any case, after saying good bye to Merlin for a bit, Sora noted that they had to head to the bailey to meet up with Leon. Thanks to getting a new map, it wasn't too hard to find where Leon went. Along the way though, there were certainly more than enough Heartless around, giving the group more than a good workout. Sora utilized the chance to get caught up on his magic, although his own Blizzard spell was outshined by Xion's own.

"Man, I'm really going to have to catch up," Sora grinned after their brief scuffle was done.

"Well Xion and I have actually been fighting over the past year while you were asleep," shrugged Roxas. "So I guess it makes sense we might be a little further ahead. Granted, I still feel like I really need to get better myself."

"Guess we'll both work on it then," Sora smiled. Right then though, he stiffened as a veil of green light surrounded him, feeling the familiar sensation of Cure. He looked over to Xion, who was indeed casting the spell.

"Your arm looked bruised...." Xion said softly. "So....I thought I'd try...."

"Oh? Didn't even notice," Sora said, winding up his arm to try it out a little. "But hey, it's as good as new. Thanks Xion."

"You're welcome...." Xion smiled a little.

With that, the trio continued on their way, taking out what Heartless they needed. One particularly nasty bunch caught them a little off-guard, making Sora shift into Guardian Form for the first time in battle. It was clearly a defense-oriented form, with an emphasis on protection over outright offense or magic. Thankfully, it made pretty good use of Sora's mobility, which he had plenty of. Sora even got the chance to joke that Roxas and Xion could just stand behind him and he'd plow through them.

"Oh good. Less work for us," Roxas smirked.

"Nice try," Sora returned the look. The little exchange got a little smile out of Xion.

Eventually, they made their over to where Leon wanted them to be. Looking out over the distance, they got a good look at the castle Sora explored on his first trip: Hollow Bastion itself. Leon made a note of how they wanted to restore the place to its former glory, perhaps even grander than that. However, one little problem was clear: the horde of Heartless that surrounded the castle. Plus, Leon pointed them towards some silver creatures: Dusks headed towards the castle themselves. Sora made sure to relay to Leon what potential troubles they may face. There was Pete, but he was too dumb to be considered a threat. The Nobodies were the true threat here, along with Organization XIII.

"You called?"

A booming voice echoed over the area, making everyone jump a little. Roxas's face immediately turned sour. That was Xemnas, no doubt about it. Just hearing the Superior's voice caused a fire to be lit inside him. Full memories or no, he knew Xemnas was primarily at fault for whatever happened to this point. If he was here, and they could defeat him, that would eliminate so many of their problems. He wasn't alone this time. He had Sora and Xion with him.

"Xemnas.....they're here," Roxas said seriously.

Speaking of whom, Xion seemed particularly tense. Hearing that voice sent goosebumps down her skin, like some dark sensation coming from the depths of her mind. Hearing Roxas speak that name immediately gave Xion a mental image: a silver-haired man looking down at her from atop a white throne.
15534121111111111111111111111.title: Continue

155341211111111111111111111111.content:
"You seem to be doing well....though your company is quite curious."

"Let's give them a little test, shall we? Consider this our welcoming."

Roxas immediately recognized Saïx's voice, followed by Xemnas's again. So, was the whole Organization hanging around somewhere? That would make things pretty convenient not going to lie. If they could just take out one of them, that could make things so much easier. Xemnas was likely out of their league, but surely the three of them couldn't take on one of them, right? He knew these guys pretty well over the past year.

"They know we're with you," Roxas told Sora. "They must be watching from somewhere."

"Got it," nodded Sora, looking everywhere for them. However, his attention was soon drawn to the Dusks appearing. "Looks like we got to take care of these first though."

With Leon's help, protecting the gate wasn't too hard between the three Keyblade wielders, though Roxas couldn't help but feel like this was too easy. They were being toyed with as far as he could tell.

"Come on, show yourself!" Sora cried out as the last Dusk fell, a bit tired of it as well.

Then, up on the ledge above the Keyblade wielders, a man in a dark coat emerged from the darkness. After a rather dramatic motion, five more coats appeared. Roxas could remember some details about them, but had to deduce that they were Demyx, Xaldin, Saïx, Xigbar, and Luxord. Axel would be pretty obvious, especially since he almost never had his hood up to begin with. Roxas wondered where he was at this time, but that would be for another time.

"Good! Now we can settle this!" Sora cried out.

"A shame.....and here I thought we could be good friends," said the first cloaked figure, Xemnas obviously. His voice lacked any sense of emotion, very much like Yen Sid's definition of a Nobody.

At that, another cloaked figure approached Xemnas. Probably Saïx if Roxas had to guess.

"No doubt about it. That is Roxas alongside Sora," said Saïx. "Quite unusual, for a Nobody to exist alongside his original."

"A fascinating development," Xemnas replied, apparently no less intrigued by this development. "It makes one wonder...."

"To my knowledge, only a replica would make such a thing possible. But we were sure the remainder of Vexen's experiments were lost in Castle Oblivion." replied Saïx.

"The method hardly matters now. All that matters is how things are," said Xemnas. "We are graced by three Keyblades now."

From underneath their hoods, Xamnas and Saïx looked down upon the group. While Sora and Roxas continued to glare at the two, Xion's face was quite the opposite. For some reason, looking at those two cloaked figures filled her with uneasiness. A bead of sweat came down the side of her head, a sign of agitation that she did not understand. Something was familiar to her about these men, and she didn't like it. Her Keyblade trembled slightly in her hands. Speaking of Xion, her presence didn't go unnoticed.

Saïx eyed the black-haired girl, his stern face growing even more so. That girl...she had a Keyblade too. Something was familiar about her. He doubted there was a wielder of the Keyblade that they'd be completely in the dark about. And, perhaps similar to Xion, something agitated him too.

"That girl is also curious," said Saïx. "I doubt we somehow missed the existence of another Keyblade."

"I believe she must be related to this as well. To Sora," said Xemnas. "I believe this mystery will clear itself up in time. However, I am most curious. Xigbar, go entertain them for a while. Use whatever means you wish."

"Oh? You mean I get to play a little rough?" another cloaked figure spoke up. You could just feel a sneer from underneath. "You don't mind your precious Keyblades getting a little dinged up?"

"Between the three of them, I doubt we need to worry," said Xemnas. "It'll only motivate them further."

"Whatever you say boss," replied Xigbar, seeming pretty pleased with this. Now he could see some things for himself.

The trio could only wonder what the cloaked figures were talking about. Sora and Roxas were both anxious to get this going, while Xion couldn't help but look back and forth between them and the figures. Before long though, the figures began to disappear, surprising Sora and Roxas. However, before they could do much about it, a portal opened up about in front of them.

"Oops, did I get in your way?" the figure taunted them.

"Move!" Sora said simply, the tension in his body no less settled.

"Now isn't that kind of rude? Shutting me down like that?" the figure continued to act in mock disappointment. "And here we just came to chat."

"He said move, Xigbar," Roxas stepped forward, Oathkeeper and Oblivion drawn. "So why don't you."

"Heh....As if, Roxas. Nice to see you again by the way," Xigbar chuckled, finally pulling his cloak down, revealing his eye-patched face and long brown and silver hair to the group. "Talk is pretty cheap. It won't change a thing."

Sora piped up a little at seeing Xigbar's face for the first time, while Xion continued to be antsy. This guy felt just like the others to her, someone she felt like she didn't want to be anywhere near. Seeing Xigbar's face, she could even see it in her mind. From what, she couldn't tell, but it wasn't good.

"I'm not in the mood to catch up," Roxas stated. "I'd prefer to get Xemnas out of the way, but I guess you'll have to do."

"We've shove you aside if we have to," Sora butted back in. "We can do this the easy way or the hard way."

"Heh heh, if I were any old dude, that might work," Xigbar chuckled again. "But we in the Organization are a cut above the rest."

"Says the guy who sat back on the sidelines and let the flunkies do the work for him," Sora smirked at him.

"Oh boy.....Roxas, have you been letting him get a bad impression of us?" Xigbar once again said in mock disappointment. "The kid's got some misconceptions."

"Well I remember you sitting back a lot of the time myself while I did your dirty work," Roxas smirked as well. "So I'd say it's pretty fair."

"Gonna cry about it?" replied Sora.

"As if!" Xigbar smirked again, clearly not put off by Sora and Roxas's tag-team taunting. "Maybe I should remind you both of who you're really dealing with here!"

With those words, Sora and Roxas both got to their ready positions, glaring at Xigbar as if waiting for an attack. Xion on the other hand, while standing a little behind the boys, felt this sensation to get them away from the man. This....this was trouble. Somehow seeing Sora and Roxas go against Xigbar filled her with dread. She couldn't figure why but....the only word she could think of was that she was scared.

Meanwhile, Xigbar just began laughing, making both Sora and Roxas raise their eyebrows.

"Hahahaha! You both got that same angry look!" he laughed. "Reminds me of another fellow I used to know."

"Will you knock it off with the talk?!" Sora replied back, now actually feeling irritated. "Saying stuff like that isn't going to psych us out."

"Who knows. You never know unless you try," Xigbar chuckled again. "Still, I am here to have a little fun myself. Boss's permission after all."

With that, out of Xigbar's hands came his signature arrowguns: Sharpshooter. Roxas of course already know how they operated. He actually already tried to give Sora at least some of the things he knew about the Organization's fighting styles, at least as much as he knew them from his missions with them.

"You know Roxas, it really is nice to see you again," Xigbar chuckled, guns at the ready. "Not entirely sure how, but it must be nice to live alongside your original."

"I said I don't want to catch up," Roxas was beginning to growl a little. Sheesh did this guy like to talk. "How I'm here doesn't matter. I am my own person."

"Roxas....don't..." Finally taking some action, Xion came behind Roxas, putting her hand on his left arm. "Don't.....You and Sora...shouldn't...."

"Xion?" Roxas questioned. Why did she seem really nervous? Didn't seem to be the type from what memories he had of her.

"Aw, that's touching Roxas. You went and got yourself a girlfriend too. You're moving up in the world," Xigbar grinned. "Girl looks familiar too."

Getting a better look at the girl was giving Xigbar the same impression Xemnas and Saïx got. There was just something about her that got Xigbar thinking. Even weirder though was that, for the briefest of seconds, over the girl's form stood an image of a boy Xigbar very much remembered. The connected between that wasn't really apparent to him, and yet it excited him all the same.

"Roxas and Xion aren't yours to control anymore," Sora got back into the conversation, ever eager to stand up for them. "The three of us will stop whatever you're planning."

"Sora...don't...." Xion again spoke, putting her remaining hand on Sora's shoulder.

"Xion....heh, doesn't ring any bells but the name's kind of catchy," Xigbar grinned again. "Maybe something will jog my memory."
155341211111111111111111111111.title: Continue

1553412111111111111111111111111.content:
By this point, Roxas was really irritated. The talking had gone on too long. Who cared what Xigbar thought about them or whatever? Beat him down here and that's one problem off the list. Simple as that.

"That's it. I've had it with your talking!" Roxas growled, clashing his blades together. "Your last chance before I come for you."

He was determined to end this right now. No more having to deal with this guy's constant talking. Roxas was ready, any feelings of hesitation long gone now. He began to take steps forward, distancing himself from Sora....

Until he felt Xion's grip on his arm tighten, further shown by both of her hands clasped around it.

"Xion?" he questioned, looking into her eyes, seeing....fear was it?

"Run....get away from here....run....You have to stop him!"

Words of that nature began to flow through Xion's head, with those last ones in particular feeling kind of familiar. Something about fighting them terrified her, or perhaps she was terrified of what they'd do to Roxas or Sora. Somehow, the idea of Roxas charging into a hopeless situation felt familiar to her, like she had told someone to stop him from getting himself hurt. It was all a mess of things that didn't connect in her head, but she could tell one thing. She couldn't let Roxas fight him. She couldn't.

"Sora...stop him...." she spoke, turning back to Sora, who looked confused.

"Huh? Me?" he asked. Why was she asking him? Did she not want either of them to fight? Sora looked back and forth between Roxas and Xion: one clearly looking like he wanted to fight, and the other looking like she wanted to leave.

"You seem a little conflicted," Xigbar chuckled again. "Must be troublesome having something anchoring you back like that."

"Xion....let me go...now," Roxas said, sternly looking back. He felt like he needed to do this. There was no reason not to in his mind. He didn't get why Xion wouldn't let him fight, and to be honest, it was irritating him a little. "We can take him."

"No, you can't," Xion said, perhaps in the clearest voice she had since coming back.

"You know kiddo, maybe she's right. You can't do it," Xigbar chimed in, before his grin grew even wider. "Really, you can't do anything. Can't do your job right. Can't keep your buddies safe. No wonder you've gotten into so many messes."

Now Roxas's temper was really flaring. Can't do this. Can't do that. It was like before all over again. Why did someone always have to have an opinion on him? The powers in his clothes were beginning to come to life, reacting to his agitated state. There was just one thing on his mind: putting Xigbar in his place, and no one was going to stop him. Not even his friends.

"Let me go!" he spat out.

Xion didn't speak but her hold didn't break, tugging even harder as he kept on resisting.

"Maybe you should just face the music kiddo...." Xigbar smirked once more. "At the end of the day...you're just a weakling, always enslaved to something..."

"THAT"S IT!"

At last, Roxas finally snapped, his powers flaring up as he shrugged Xion off his arm. However, against his notice, the force from this action was greater than he would have figured, due to the increase in his powers. Xion cried a bit as she was thrown off his arm, actually going airborne for a bit before landing hard on the stone floor, her head actually bouncing pretty badly off the ground. Sora cried her name as he came over to her, while Roxas charged forward.

"Hahahahaha!" Xigbar laughed at the sight, as Roxas's blades made impact with his guns. "Finally ready for some fun?"

"Ready to kick your butt is more like it!" Roxas spat out as he slashed out one of his blades, pushing Xigbar up into the air as he began to follow.

Xion whimpered a little bit as she began to sit up, her head feeling more scrambled than it was before. Sora had actually run over to her side, asking if she was okay. She gave a little nod, nursing her throbbing head as she put a hand up to cast Cure on it. As she did though, she felt something there, bringing her hand down to show a little bit of blood. The impact probably scrapped her head a little, nothing that would be hard to heal. Though, the physical discomfort wasn't what concerned her. Her thoughts were still on Roxas, her eyes looking up to keep track of his form.

"Xion...." Sora mumbled a little, looking up to see Roxas. He wondered if he should go up and fight too, but then he'd be leaving Xion on her own. Then again, Roxas knew all about the Organization. He could probably handle it.

Roxas continued to slash after slash on Xigbar, trying not to give the gun user even a chance to fire back. Given how much Xigbar liked his range, Roxas figured keeping things up close and personal would be a natural counter to that. Plus, he'd seen how he fought during missions together. He figured as long as he could keep Xigbar's spacial powers in check, he'd have an advantage. The two fighters bounced from rooftop to rooftop, with Roxas doing the majority of fighting while Xigbar tried to get in shots while he could. He seemed to be struggling though, making Roxas smile.

"Good. I'm faster than he is," he said, his blades shining a bit. Getting back into the swing of things with his light powers was coming along slowly, but he figured he had enough for what he needed. He surrounded Xigbar with pillars of light, ramming each into him one by one. Some he dodged, but others went right into him.

"Ugh!" Xigbar groaned, being sent back by the force of the pillars.

"Now I got you!" Roxas cried out, jumping right up to deliver another combo on him. There was something really gratifying about this.

Sora was honestly amazed. Roxas really was fast, and it really showed how skilled he was over his time in the Organization. Heck, perhaps he could take on one himself. Sora actually began to cheer him on, still remaining by Xion's side just in case she needed help. Xion didn't move or speak, having completed the healing on her head, which was still sore. Her eyes never left Roxas, not exactly sharing the same enthusiasm Sora had. Even in the haziness of her head, she just knew this was a bad idea. Something just kept telling her that he was in mortal danger right now.

Roxas once again sent Xigbar into the air, having deflected some arrowshots. Some grazed him but nothing that could stop him. After Xigbar blocked a strike, Roxas brought his leg around to strike him, sending Xigbar flying backwards again. He was feeling it now. This time, he can end it for sure. He thrust forward, right over Xigbar's flying form. Another strike and he could bring this fight to a close.

Instead, all he got was a chuckle.

"You know, I really did hope we could have some fun," said Xigbar, bringing his head up as the two were still flying over houses. "But I suppose you don't have much left."

"What?!" Roxas cried out.

Suddenly, Roxas was gasping out, a knee getting thrust into his back from Xigbar who had rapidly teleported behind him. That was a lot faster than he had been teleporting during their fight. In fact, Roxas hadn't even seen him move. A blink and he was no longer there.

"Since Sora seems perfectly fine, I'm guessing you still ended up giving him the power you were borrowing," spoke Xigbar. "While I'm not sure how you're existing on your own, it's pretty clear to me that you aren't nearly as fast or strong as you were before."

"What do you mean?" Roxas turned around and slashed, to which Xigbar blacked and gave him a point blank shot that forced him to land on his back on a roof. "I can't be.....but Axel...."

He fought Axel back before, and Axel couldn't have been holding back much if at all, so Roxas had no reason to believe that he was any weaker. Although....that fight with Axel did come before he went back to Sora....no....that couldn't be true could it? He didn't feel weaker, though if his attacks had really been doing nothing to Xigbar then.....

"Guess Sora must have taken a lot of you with him," Xigbar chuckled, reloading his guns. "Before you were decently tough. Now you better feel any tougher than Dusks."

"Don't compare me to those!" Roxas cried back, readying his blades again as he steadied himself. "I'm way better!"

"Really?" Xigbar clucked his tongue a little, motioning over to where Sora and Xion were. "You remember how you even got into this fight? What you did to your girl down there?"

"What? What did I....?" Roxas trailed off a little.

He looked over to where Xion sat, her eyes still fixated on him. However, upon looking closer, Roxas could notice a couple things. Her hand looked like it had blood on it, and he could make out what was at least a bruise underneath her dark hair. When did she get that? She was just fine before. With that, his mind flashed back to what just happened a while ago, when he threw her off his arm to jump into battle. He didn't intend to really do more than shrug her off. Did he do that....?

"No....I didn't mean to..." Roxas said to himself, becoming increasingly guilt-ridden at what he seemed to have done in his enraged state.

"Not very heroic you might say," Xigbar chuckled. "First you betray us, and then you toss her to the side. Perhaps you need a little lesson in how to be a man."

"What do..UGH!"

As quickly as he could think, Roxas suddenly felt Xigbar's knee in his gut, before a follow-up attack sent him flying into the roof of another house. Staggering back to his feet, Roxas suddenly felt bullet after bullet raining down upon him, hitting just about everywhere on the roof and on him.

"Don't give up on me now, kiddo," Xigbar sneered darkly. "I'm just now getting into the swing of things."
1553412111111111111111111111111.title: Continue

15534121111111111111111111111111.content:
Sora groaned as he watched Roxas begin to get pelted. Had that guy been holding back this whole time? Roxas looked like he had him on the ropes, and now things had gone the opposite way.

"We need to help him!" Sora said, bringing his Keyblade back out.

However, before he or Xion could move, Xigbar fired some shots in their direction, seeming to be intentionally miss them. It made Sora pause, having to brace himself a little before being able to look back up. Xigbar chuckled as he went back to Roxas, teleporting left and right as Roxas tried to get hits in.

"Let me guess, you figured you'd have a chance based on seeing our skills on missions?" Xigbar asked rhetorically before bashing Roxas again. "As if! Going all out on the small fry would have just been a waste."

Many things were going through Roxas's head, too much for him to process in the middle of battle. Not only Xigbar, but also worrying about Xion's condition. The one he caused at that. Just thinking about it was making him feel a little sick. Well, again, he didn't get much chance to think on it before Xigbar was once again firing bullet after bullet, forcing Roxas to have to dodge again. However, he was pretty banged up from Xigbar's previous attempts, to the point where he was limping a little.

"Eh, figures," Xigbar said. "Guess that's all you're good for now."

"Grrr......" Roxas groaned a little. "I'll....get you...sometime..."

"Heh heh heh, maybe," Xigbar chuckled, dispelling his guns. "But, before we wrap this up..."

Just like that, Xigbar zoomed in front of Roxas, kicking him down to the ground in front of Sora and Xion. Xion gasped slightly at the sight of Roxas's beat-up form, even as he tried to get up again. Sora came over to help him sit up.

"You alright?" Sora asked.

"Ugh....can't say I am...." Roxas groaned, feeling a little too weak to fully stand now. Xigbar grinned as he stood around where he did before the fight started.

"Well, I thank you for the lovely time together," he said. "I figure now you know who you're up against. You're going to have to get a loooot better than that."

"Just watch!" Sora said back. "We'll get stronger, and then you'll be eating your words."

"Heh, I look forward to it, kiddo," Xigbar chuckled, as darkness began to surround him. "Catch you later!"

And like that, Xigbar's form disappeared, leaving the trio alone once again. Compared to the good feeling they had taking care of the Heartless and Nobodies before, all three of them felt a sense of defeat. Roxas, of course, felt it more than any of them. He just got totally outplayed, pulled into something he probably could have avoided had he actually kept a cool head. It was his fault Xigbar was able to push his buttons so easily, not to mention....

Soon enough, Roxas felt green energy surrounding, an obvious sign of Cure. He gasped a little, looking over to his right to see Xion's hands out, using her magic on him. Her face was indescribable, so Roxas couldn't tell at all what she was thinking or feeling. Still, it reminded him of how guilty he felt. Unintentional or not, he hurt someone he considered a friend.

"Why....?" Roxas asked softly, not sure if it was directed at anyone.

"You're....hurt...," Xion spoke just as softly, letting her magic work as much as it could. At least it could get Roxas on his feet again.

Sora wasn't sure what to say to his two companions, as much as he would have loved to say something funny or encouraging. The right words just never seemed to come. He had so many questions in his head: the nature of Organization XIII, and what had happened between these two in the past. Still, that wouldn't stop him from being there to support them as best he could. With that said though, he did have a job to do himself. Something was calling to him, something he was already familiar with.

He excused himself from the two for a bit, bringing his Keyblade out. The blade began to shine, forming a familiar symbol as Sora began to see a giant keyhole in the sky. Letting the motions go through him, he aimed his blade high, the light striking the keyhole and making it shine.

"I get it now...." Sora mumbled. "That must be one the gates Yen Sid talked about. Maybe we can go to other worlds now."

"So you gotta run again?" asked Leon, who had been taking care of his tasks while Roxas and Xigbar fought.

"We probably should. Other worlds are calling," Sora said resolutely, though it lessened when he looked at his friends. "Although, it might be a while until we're really good to go."

"Well, in that case, why not at least spend the night with us?" Leon offered. "It looks like you've had a busy day. Best to rest and make sure you're good to go."

"Thanks Leon. I think we'll take you up on that," Sora smiled, before turning to the others. "You two okay with that?"

"Yeah...I'm okay with it," Roxas sighed as Xion's magic left him. "I probably shouldn't go anywhere like this."

Xion just gave a little nod of acknowledgement as the trio got together with Leon to head back to the hangout, all eager to just be able to sit down for a bit. Heavy thoughts followed each of them on their way.

*The White Room*

The members of Organization XIII had returned to their giant gathering room, each giving their own thoughts on their first real encounter with Sora, the Keyblade's chosen. Xaldin wasn't too impressed, given he was just a boy, though Xigbar, upon coming in later, was quick to mock that. Sora was pure of heart, certainly unlike the majority of them. The remaining members squabbled a bit over the boy, with Luxord wondering if he'd made for a good game while Demyx just casually wrote it all off.

"Sora aside, how could he be complete while Roxas lives?" Xaldin asked.

"Quite curious," said Luxord as he was shuffling through his cards. "Perhaps another player has entered the game."

"The only possibility would be if there was a vessel for him to occupy," said Saïx. "Roxas surely would have lost his form upon returning to Sora, and a body doesn't just form from nothing. The only thing that would fulfill that role would be a replica."

"You talking about those toys from Castle Oblivion?" Luxord asked casually, not even looking at them. "Weren't all of Vexen's experiments lost when he was destroyed?"

"Which makes one wonder how we have arrived at this point," said Saïx. "Vexen could be unpredictable. It's possible something of his could be behind this. I believe we should seek out this answer."

"Perhaps that answer will come in time," Xemnas's booming voice spoke out. "However, one way or another, it means there are three keys out there to complete Kingdom Hearts. Our plans haven't changed. They will seek out the worlds, and in turn fulfill our goals as well."

"Yep, they can't very well ignore the worlds," Xigbar chuckled. "No no, there's no way they can resist that. The only alternative would be to take us out before that could happen, and I'd say they very much doubt their ability to do that right now."

"Yeah, I saw that whole fight!" Demyx waved his arms around. "Seriously dude, you played him like a drum."

"Heh heh, wasn't that hard to bait him. I'd say he knows his place now," said Xigbar. "Probably felt a little too cocky after Axel failed to get him back."

"Axel....we'll have to deal with him too," Xaldin spoke. "He never returned after his mission."

"Oh he'll have his time eventually," spoke Saïx coldly, closing his eyes a little. "While we're on the subject, that girl Sora and Roxas were with....."

"She was quite a looker," laughed Demyx. "Could swear she looks familiar though. Can't put my finger on it."

"I too felt odd looking at her," said Xaldin. "A certain familiarity."

"What a coincidence, so did I!" Xigbar said dramatically. "Who knows, maybe we're all forgetting something. You all saw it. She had his Keyblade."

As Xemnas watched his underlings talk, he mused to himself. The girl struck a chord with him as well. He got the sense that she wasn't totally unrelated somehow. Xigbar was right that the girl possessed a Keyblade that only Sora or his own Nobody, Roxas, would have. That could only mean she was related, and the idea intrigued him.

"I believe we should keep an eye on the girl," spoke Xemnas. "Roxas may be beyond our reach now, but perhaps she might prove useful."

"Great...more work..." groaned Demyx, sliding in his seat a little.

"So many wild cards. Fascinating," muttered Luxord. "More players makes the game more fun."

The group began another round of talking amongst themselves. Saïx turned to Xemnas however.

"I must ask, why did you allow Xigbar to fight them?" asked Saïx to Xemnas.

"That wasn't the plan at first. I merely intended to make our presence known to Sora," said Xemnas. "However, seeing him and his new companions, I admit I was curious to see them tested a little. So I allowed Xigbar the chance to show our former comrade his place."

"Heh heh, and I quite enjoyed the chance," snickered Xigbar. "Poor sap didn't know what hit him."

"As long as you didn't harm them beyond repair," spoke Saïx. "We require them for more than your own fun."

"Yeah yeah whatever," shrugged Xigbar.

"Gentlemen...," Xemnas spoke again. "Regardless of the circumstances, the chosen of the Keyblade has set forth on a new adventure. So make sure it is one he will remember."

"Roger boss," Xigbar mock saluted.

All the members acknowledged their orders before leaving one by one. Saïx took his own leave to attend to his own matters, leaving the Superior by himself. All alone, he chuckled hollowly.

"My my, what curious circumstances," he mused. "Three wielders sharing the same Keyblade."

155341211111111111111111111111111.content:
Hollow Bastion

With the Heartless attacks finally coming down for the time being, the group allowed themselves to be taken in by the committee for the night. It made for some nice casual time, something the trio hadn't had really since this all started. Plus, it kind of helped to finally get some food and rest, something that was further punctuated when Xion's stomach growled, getting a good laugh out of most around and making the girl just want to hide somewhere.

That being said, all three of them couldn't forget their encounter with Organization XIII. Sora was amazed by how strong they seemed to be, though he wasn't letting that get him down. They HAD to defeat them, there was no maybe there. To that end, he was staying positive while also trying to cheer up his friends.

"Hey, don't let it get you down! Next time we'll show them," Sora said as he handed each of them a plate of food.

"Yeah...." Roxas muttered while Xion wordlessly nodded.

With the battle done, Xion's head was back to being hazy. It felt like any emotion she needed only came when it was necessary, and now that everyone was safe, her head had returned to being a mess. Still, what happened earlier had stayed in her mind. She wasn't upset that Roxas hurt her by accident. She knew he wasn't that type. No, the lingering effects of how she felt then were disturbing her. The fear she felt as Roxas was fighting. Why was she so afraid? She couldn't figure that out, but it weighed her down all the same.

Roxas on the other hand felt the worst out of all of them. Not just that he got completely played by Xigbar, but the very fact that he hurt Xion like that. It felt so unlike him, and yet that's what he did. He felt like he could barely look her in the eye after what he did. It was to that end that he sat by himself as he ate. On that note though, Leon had kept his eyes on Roxas since they returned. Sighing a little, he came over to join Roxas.

"Still thinking about earlier?" Leon asked as he began to eat.

"Yeah," Roxas said, not bothering to hide it. "I can't believe I did something like that. Not only did I get robed into a hopeless battle, but I hurt my friend."

"Hey, I don't think she holds it against you," replied Leon. "You don't seem like the kind of guy to hurt someone on purpose. You kind of give off the same feeling as Sora."

"You wouldn't be the first to say that," Roxas chuckled sadly. "Still, it feels like my anger gets the best of me at times. Every time it happens, it's like I allow something bad to happen."

"Well, nobody's perfect," Leon chuckled a little. "Heaven knows I've done plenty I regret. All you can do is to make sure you learn from it."

"Wow, Leon giving a pep talk?" Yuffie giggled as she popped in between them. "Now I've seen everything."

"Give it a rest, Yuffie," Leon rolled his eyes. "I can give decent conversation when I want to."

"How often is that? Never?" Yuffie gave a very Sora-like grin before turning to Roxas. "Still, for what it's worth, he's right. Have confidence in yourself! I bet the three of you will take down those black coats next time!"

Roxas actually smiled at that. Sure, as sucky as that whole thing was, at least there were ways to rebound. Roxas already had an idea of how good these people were from Sora's memories, but interacting with them in person really helped drive the point home. Even Xion seemed to at least be enjoying the company, even if she said nothing.

"You're right," Roxas said a little sternly. "Next time will be different. I won't let Xion get hurt ever again, not by me or anyone else."

"Woo! There you go!" Yuffie cheered, rocking Roxas a little before smiling wider. "Speaking of Xion, she seems especially important to you. Got a big old crush on her?!"

"What does that mean?" Roxas asked, a question mark visibly appearing over his head. "Why would I want to crush her?"

"Ah...wow, and I thought Leon took everything too literally," Yuffie pouted, getting an indignant snort from said brunette. "I mean you like her a lot. Seriously, you look at her like Sora did whenever he brought up Kairi."

Like her a lot? What exactly did that mean? It kind of brought Roxas's mind back to a very old conversation he had with Axel. After a mission to Beasts' Castle, he had asked about love, as it was a word constantly brought up there. Axel described it as a stronger feeling than friendship, or something to that effect. He had written it off given the whole "Nobodies can't feel" thing everyone kind of took to heart. Was that what Yuffie was talking about? Kind of hard to tell. Roxas wasn't really sure what to make of it. Did Xion make him feel something different?

"Ugh, forget it. You're just a blockhead like Leon," Yuffie pouted again.

"I'm right here, you know," Leon stated casually.

"That's the point," Yuffie said.

Meanwhile, Xion had quietly been observing everyone. After a while, her eyes had fixated on Roxas, just as he was talking with Leon. Seeing Roxas smile again actually brought a small smile to her own, her prior injury not even a factor anymore. With that, she just casually listened to Aerith talk.

The rest of the time went by rather well all things considered. Before long, it was time to turn in and get some rest. Sora was feeling oddly exhausted for someone who had just slept for a year, something Roxas made sure to point out when he exaggerated how tired he was. Taking the slight with a grin, Sora just replied that a growing boy requires sleep, making Roxas roll his eyes.

After that, with much on their minds, the trio went to sleep.

That Night

"Roxas. Good luck today."

Xion curiously watched Roxas, intrigued by this dream of hers. She was pretty sure this was a memory, showing off her face to Roxas for the first time. They had started taking missions together, and it was the first time she actually spoke a real sentence. Even Roxas seemed surprised, though there was a hint of a smile at seeing her for real for the first time. With that, the two were beginning their mission. Roxas was the one with the Keyblade while she assisted with magic.

However, the good feeling stopped there, as after Roxas took down a Heartless, he suddenly turned his Keyblade in her direction. It feel like a sudden shift in the mood, as the bright suburbs of Twilight Town faded into darkness.

"Roxas?" she asked.

"Sorry, but I have to," he said darkly, gripping his blade and facing her like he did the Heartless. "You made me do this."

Xion had little time to ponder what in the world he was talking about, but with speed she couldn't match, Roxas struck forward, slashing her across the chest.

Xion's eyes suddenly popped open right when that happened, a hand going to her chest to feel the spot where she got struck. Nothing. There was nothing there. She wasn't in Twilight Town, but in the very room she fell asleep in. So, it was just a dream, a really really horrible dream. She was sure part of that was real, fighting alongside Roxas in Twilight Town, a name she could recognize now if vaguely. However, everything afterwards...that couldn't have happened, right?

Xion felt a bead of sweat going down her face, her breathing slightly faster. Why would she dream that? That couldn't have been because of earlier, right? That was just an accident. Roxas didn't mean to hurt her. And yet, that sensation of his Keyblade slashing her..of being attacked by him....why was there a sense of familiarity there? Was there something else she didn't remember?

All she could say was she didn't like the feeling of this, and as she tried to get back to sleep, she hoped it was just nothing more than a dream. Despite her attempts though, the feeling of dread didn't dissipate.

The Next Morning

"Ahhhhh, good morning!" cheered Sora.

"You apparently slept well," groaned Roxas. "I could tell from your snoring."

"That just means I'm a healthy sleeper," Sora retorted.

"Right...." Roxas rolled his eyes again.

The Hollow Bastion group eventually joined them, as did Xion. She barely looked in any of their directions though. It took both Sora and Roxas saying good morning for her to actually give a physical reaction, which was barely more than a nod and wave. There was a slight smile, but it seemed...somewhat pained. Sora and Roxas looked to each other, wondering what was happening.

"Maybe she's just half-asleep," Sora shrugged. "Maybe she was also sleeping for a long time like I was."

"I don't know," Roxas said, but he dropped the subject soon after.

In any case, they all had to get ready to leave. Getting a few snacks for the road after filling their bellies, the trio thanked the committee for their hospitality. Yuffie told them to come by soon, to which Sora replied they definitely would. With a wave good bye, they were off to the Highwind, getting settled back into the ship.

"Now, I"M the one driving this time!" Sora made sure to make sure he was the one in charge.

"Fine, whatever," Roxas said from his seat. "Just don't run into anything and I won't say a word on it."

Sora took the Highwind back into space, immediately checking in to what pathways got unlocked because of earlier. The Highwind's scanners picked up two worlds: Land of Dragons and Beast's Castle. Predictably, the latter got Roxas's attention, and even got Xion to widen her eyes slightly.

"Hmmm, where to first?" Sora pondered out loud.

Story 15: Slime Time

A group of innocent Dragon Quest Slimes who are saved from other monsters by the main character of their game (the character being the boy version if there is an option between genders) afterwards discover the ability of possession, caused by going down their throats. They decide to possess different girls (among which are the female party members) in order to give him a harem. They can access all of their hosts' memories, with the hosts still being around, but unable to take any action. Multiple slimes can reside in one girl, but one slime can't control multiple girls. The main character doesn't find out.

Story 16: A Risen Desire

When Grima goes to follow Lucina's group through time, the remains of Robin secretly uses the last of his energy to try to separate the Risen from Grima. He partially succeeds, breaking the link for a group, but they latch onto him instead. They still have the mindsets of Risen for the most part, but they have become self-aware. They wish to serve Robin, and make his life better, so they decide to use their newfound intelligence in order to find a way to do so.

They decide to see if they can possess bodies by one of them possessing Lucina in secret during the first battle with the Risen in game, while she's separated from Chrom's group, upon one doing this, they decide to make Robin a harem, but knowing that he wouldn't approve of the girls being possessed, and wanting to keep under the radar because of Grima being around, they keep it a secret. The Risen possess girls by turning into smoke like the smoke that comes out of their mouths, and going down the throats of the girls. When the Risen take over, the girls' eyes will glow red like the Risens' eyes for a brief moment, then turn back to normal a they lightly let out a burp of the smoke.

Story 17: Shadows Spread

A group of Shadow Heartless regain some sense of self when Kairi turns Sora back to normal. They have little to no memory of their pasts, but imprint on Sora, seeing him as having become a sort of Alpha Heartless, due to getting back to normal while still being a Heartless, even after rejoining with Roxas. They still have a desire for hearts, and instinctively decide to go about getting them a new way... by hijacking the bodies and hearts of those who already have them, choosing girls in order to give Sora a bunch of girls.

The Shadows possess girls by lunging into their chests, right where their hearts are, or would be in the cases of empty vessels and nobodies who haven't grown replacement hearts. Kairi, Naminé, and Xion are amongst those possessed. The Shadows have access to the memories and abilities of the girls (including being able to use Keyblades), and show no visable signs of the Heartless, with the Princesses of Hearts' own hearts of pure light covering their darkness up so that no one notices.

Story 18: Master PC

A version of the Master PC arrives in a fictional world. This version is in laptop form, but can have its programming uploaded into another device, and is indestructible, virus proof, and has unlimited charge. It has a form of sentience that will latch onto the main male protagonist (or a protagonist in the case of multiple).

It will try to manipulate the person operating it into using it to improve the life of the person it attaches to, even at the expense of others, including the one operating it, whether by having them unconsciously type extra things while not paying attention to the keyboard, or by mentally nudging them to indulge in desires, such as payback or fantasies.

There is a general alteration page, along with pages for each person, showing a model of how they look at the moment, down to pose of wardrobe, their statistics, and bios. The changes can either be retroactive or remembered normally, depending on the operator's choice (even being able to make some people remember retroactively and some not)

Note that the PC can be used against its desires, but it takes paying attention to what the operator is typing, and the PC has the ability to upload its sentience into whoever is operating it as a defense mechanism while they are using it, with them potentially not realizing it's happening, which can be halted by stopping typing. Stopping won't reverse the process, but it can be reversed with other mental altering methods. How fast the person is infected depends on mental fortitude. It can cancel out any and all mental alterations made to the operator by other sources upon them using it if it desires.
